commit_message:
Make the Python 3 job voting

This seems to run quite reliably, and making it voting is required
for the openstack-wide python 3 goal.

Change-Id: I5e5391c7f02be91a1ba8b02e4846b3ab843648e0

Would be nice to see the email output pasted in the job'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-01-02 15:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@rlandy
I've tested locally, and it works as expected:

config2.yaml:
require_auth: True
mail_from: tripleoresults@gmail.com
templates_path: template/
log_url: 'http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/'
api_server: 'http://tempest-sendmail.tripleo.org:8080/api/v1.0/sendmail'
use_api_server: True
default_log_url: 'http://logs.openstack.org'
emails:
  - mail: 'arxcruz@gmail.com'
    name: 'Arx Cruz'
    topics: 'tripleoci'
template: template.html

execute with:

LOG_PATH=http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-nonha-tempest-oooq-ocata/6f8f29e/ ./tempestmail.py -c config2.yaml --job periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-tempest --file tests/fixtures/console_fail.log --skip-file ../../vars/tempest_skip_master.yml

It will send an email with the subject: [tripleo] Job periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-tempest results"}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-01-02 15:21:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Would be nice to see the email output pasted in the job

I'll be working on python jobs for quickstart changes so this would be tested on-the-fly."}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-01-04 13:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
[tempestmail] Custom email for different matchers

Define a set of custom tags for each filter block to be added to
the email subject. A separate email will be sent to each email
address that matches the criteria.

Change-Id: I6be404c8b25eeefc1f9574c8a26a5b320d62d2c6
Closes-Bug: #1730409

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 16:49:30.000000000', 'message': 'ci/telemetry: Decrease test_telemetry_integration time

To decrease the time test_telemetry_integration takes, we do the
following:

* Enable ManagePolling so ceilometer agents will poll every
  ceilometer::agent::polling::polling_interval interval (already set to
  15)
* We change the publishers list to set an archive policy to use for
  Gnocchi. We use high so one 1 points will be keep every 60s.

Note that the tempest telemetry.alarm_granularity configuration must be
kept in sync with the archive policy. This is done here:
I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

The test should takes 2 minutes instead of 10 after this change.

Change-Id: Ie00d3487d54f4d1226f6a8a210975eabdcd8a96c
Depends-On: I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

commit_message:
ci/telemetry: Decrease test_telemetry_integration time

To decrease the time test_telemetry_integration takes, we do the
following:

* Enable ManagePolling so ceilometer agents will poll every
  ceilometer::agent::polling::polling_interval interval (already set to
  15)
* We change the publishers list to set an archive policy to use for
  Gnocchi. We use high so one 1 points will be keep every 60s.

Note that the tempest telemetry.alarm_granularity configuration must be
kept in sync with the archive policy. This is done here:
I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

The test should takes 2 minutes instead of 10 after this change.

Change-Id: Ie00d3487d54f4d1226f6a8a210975eabdcd8a96c
Depends-On: Ie8703337f98ccd53db2724c21861d7ba06243d16
(cherry picked from commit bf819a0cdb9a48738072ad5644e407816550417b)

commit_message:
Use relative path in ipv6 nic configs

The path to run-os-net-config.sh in these nic config templates for ci
should be relative, not absolute. The absolute path does not honor a
different directory specified via --templates, and it also fails the
overcloud deploy entirely b/c the absolute path does not exist in the
plan in swift.

Change-Id: I85ac081571965f42beef4bd283db985b9a03078f

[{'created': '2018-01-08 16:20:02.000000000', 'message': 'Start step at 0 for update_ + upgrade_steps_playbook

In I93dc8b4cefbd729ba7afa3a4d81b4ac95344cac2 for bug 1717292 the
step variable passed into the update_steps_playbook and the
upgrade_steps_playbook outputs is set to start at sequence 1. This

step 0 will never be executed.

commit_message:
Start step at 0 for update_ + upgrade_steps_playbook

In I93dc8b4cefbd729ba7afa3a4d81b4ac95344cac2 for bug 1717292 the
step variable passed into the update_steps_playbook and the
upgrade_steps_playbook outputs is set to start at sequence 1. This
means that any upgrade or update_tasks that are expected to run in
step 0 will never be executed.

Change-Id: Ic2dab617269d47c4ea028cb35cdba2068a467ff9
Closes-Bug: 1741926

commit_message:
Add more_info URL to the JSON output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as JSON does not put the ``more_info``
URL in the output as it would if the output format is HTML.  This patch
set updates the JSON formatter to include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline
with the HTML display.

Change-Id: I58a8490b427fe146d517a8aff124f4443562f48b
Closes-Bug: #1695890
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Add an additional description for 'token_ttl'

The unit of 'token_ttl' is not clear
in the help text in nova/conf/consoleauth.py.
So add the unit (in seconds) in the help text.

TrivialFix

messages: [{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-04 16:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-09 05:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks!'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 16:41:13.000000000', 'message': "Use waiter method to check server status

The status of an instance could be 'ACTIVE' right after a lease ends,
since the task of deleting the instance is still in progress.

This patch replaces the assertion to check whether the instance is
terminated with a waiter method. The method periodically checks for the
existance of the specified instance until the instance is deleted.

* Code sync from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527874/

Change-Id: I32f2ef3ddbb30da8061ccc035aae0428e6dd5450
"}]
commit_message:
Use waiter method to check server status

The status of an instance could be 'ACTIVE' right after a lease ends,
since the task of deleting the instance is still in progress.

This patch replaces the assertion to check whether the instance is
terminated with a waiter method. The method periodically checks for the
existance of the specified instance until the instance is deleted.

* Code sync from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527874/

Change-Id: I32f2ef3ddbb30da8061ccc035aae0428e6dd5450

commit_message:
Update identity/tokens section in security-guide

- add link to release notes that mentions uuid token is being deprecated
- fernet token is the default token provider in Identity service

Change-Id: I2acf01a77a27c1b0fb72a5bd78a38f8b0e83e16c
Closes-bug: #1734992

commit_message:
Remove 'tempest' from patrole jobs name

All of the patrole job run patrole tests only,
not tempest tests. It is better to name them patrole
only and remove the 'tempest' from their name.

tempest-* jobs are one which run tempest integration
tests.

Change-Id: I2252d2869b8714cd9c1aaee7fecacda7711a5c2e

commit_message:
Docker Logging Support

Support configuring the services to just dump out to stdout/error to
get picked up by docker logging mechanisms. This allows kubectl logs
and kubernetes log plugins to be supported out of the box.

Change-Id: If572f8d2657b0ae7a97f5a9fa0bc17697de740a3
Partially-Implements: blueprint centralized-logging
Partially-Implements: blueprint docker-logging

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 08:57:22.000000000', 'message': 'Make ovn_client create_network idempotent

While creating a network, the call to bump the revision
in the neutron database could fail. That means that a later
healing attempt will try to recreate the network on the
ovn database.

This change makes the ovn_client.create_network idempotent
on the logical switch add call to ovsdbapp. The physnet
provnet port and metadata port creation are already designed
as idempotent.

I found no obvious place to test it, but I believe we should
do it when we migrate to ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: I20e83a0e51c8d1da3b160b2356b7232873a7a8af
'}]
commit_message:
Make ovn_client create_network idempotent

While creating a network, the call to bump the revision
in the neutron database could fail. That means that a later
healing attempt will try to recreate the network on the
ovn database.

This change makes the ovn_client.create_network idempotent
on the logical switch add call to ovsdbapp. The physnet
provnet port and metadata port creation are already designed
as idempotent.

I found no obvious place to test it, but I believe we should
do it when we migrate to ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: I20e83a0e51c8d1da3b160b2356b7232873a7a8af

commit_message:
Can't use exiting port If this port has been used once when create container

    We use pre-exiting port 1 when create container A, then delete container A.
If we use port 1 to create container B, we'll get the error :"Port 1 is still in use."
    Update the port's device_id if it is a pre-existing prot when delete the container.

Change-Id: I6481a5737eef0256c426555d2a01918eb1d14ce7
Closes-bug: #1741433

have been enabled.  Currently this parameter and
NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled are mutually exclusive so

Change-Id: Ia895d7190f0fb8e97c87b3178461d9fc26393b9b

'}]
commit_message:
Manila network plugin address family support

Set NetworkPluginIpv6Enabled if IPv6 networks
have been enabled.  Currently this parameter and
NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled are mutually exclusive so
set the latter false as well.  Default is IPv4
with NetworkPluginIPv4Enabled.

Depends-On: Ic7e5b5351e429755ba48613ab89d1b7e7d6e2d34
Change-Id: Ia895d7190f0fb8e97c87b3178461d9fc26393b9b
(cherry picked from commit d8b1d64add50da4a07f838b9730a3044be7a828d)

commit_message:
configure gnocchi as publisher

Gnocchi is the default publisher but we miss to configure it.

This change does it.

This is only done in pike branch because option must be passed through
the publisher url on master.

Change-Id: Ie8703337f98ccd53db2724c21861d7ba06243d16

[{'created': '2017-12-01 21:59:36.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid retrieving IP from a missing bridge

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid retrieving IP from a missing bridge

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a

commit_message:
Fix intermittent check_delete_headers failure

Use a utils.Timestamp object to set a more realistic x-timestamp
header to avoid intermittent failure when str(time.time()) results
in a rounded up value.

Closes-Bug: 1741912
Change-Id: I0c54d07e30ecb391f9429e7bcfb782f965ece1ea

commit_message:
cleanup private bdm methods

Some private methods related to block device mappings had
unnecessary arguments or used kwargs where the value is always
passed so a kwarg isn't needed. Since they are private methods,
there is no compatibility issue with changing them, which should
improve readability/usability. This effects that cleanup.

Change-Id: I74104d16ef76496426a9f10a10250d355d757f1a

(1 comment)

A couple of thoughts on this:

Originally this was not done because messing with the existing nic-configs will break anyone who is actually using them on upgrade.  It's probably reasonable to say we just don't care about that for this particular set since it's unlikely anyone is using these multi-nic templates in production, so I'm not necessarily opposed to that.

If we do that though, we at least need a release note to let people know that this change is being made.

Just to follow-up, the v2 version of these templates worked as expected for me locally.  I've pushed a test patch that modifies the existing tripleo-ci templates in place to try to narrow down the problem: https://review.openstack.org/483064

I do see an error running the script during the networkdeployment step though: OSError: [Errno 8] Exec format error  

That's most likely why the config isn't getting applied to the overcloud nodes.  Unfortunately the file lives in /var/lib and we don't capture that so it's hard to say why the error happened.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-07-12 19:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-12 21:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-22 20:59:46.000000000', 'message': 'Copy nic configs from tripleo-ci repo

We need to actually test the configs that we provide. However, the
configs we provide do not work in our CI environments. This patch
copies in the configs from the CI repo so we can start pointing
to them in our jobs.

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff
'}, {'created': '2017-06-26 12:37:14.000000000', 'message': 'Copy nic configs from tripleo-ci repo

We need to actually test the configs that we provide. However, the
configs we provide do not work in our CI environments. This patch
copies in the configs from the CI repo so we can start pointing
to them in our jobs.

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff
'}, {'created': '2017-06-28 20:49:38.000000000', 'message': "Start using nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

We may want to also consider a massive cleanup of the existing
network dir with a proper deprecation period, but that is an
exercise left for later.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd (though there are some settings like MTU that
are not actually good for a real deployment).

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

commit_message:
Start using nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

We may want to also consider a massive cleanup of the existing
network dir with a proper deprecation period, but that is an
exercise left for later.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd (though there are some settings like MTU that
are not actually good for a real deployment).

Change-Id: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:33:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Overall this looks fine.  My only objection is that it appears to be using the old os-apply-config nic-config format which we don't want to do on Ocata and up.  The only way we should use that is if these templates will be used for Newton deployments, which didn't support the new script-based format.  Since the template version is set to Ocata, it's safe to assume these will never be used on Newton though.

On that version note, if we're not planning to convert the stable branch jobs to use these templates we can probably go ahead and use pike as the template version.  I don't know what the plans are on that though, and ocata will work in any case so I'm not worried about it.

Also maybe worth noting that there is an existing v2 ipv6 set of templates in OVB: https://github.com/cybertron/openstack-virtual-baremetal/tree/master/overcloud-templates/ipv6-network-templates-v2  I'm guessing these were based off the v1 templates in tripleo-ci.  Fortunately switching versions is as simple as changing the version number and re-generating. :-)"}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2017-10-24 16:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-10-24 16:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-10-24 17:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2017-10-24 19:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2017-10-24 21:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Start using ipv6 nic-configs from THT repo instead of tripleo-ci

This patch uses the net-iso gen tool to create ipv6 multi-nic network
isolation templates with the same settings we currently use in CI.
Rather than overwrite existing example configs in the network dir,
we instead create a new dir under ci/environments to hold the
nic-configs we use in CI jobs. This alleviates any concerns about
backwards-compatibility and breaking users on upgrade.

By moving these nic-configs to THT, we are bringing them inline
with the other heat environments we have moved out of the CI repo.
It also allows an end user to start from a configuration that we
have actually CI'd.

Change-Id: Iba56667e11510a1cc2470a7dfdc6bc0158878010

commit_message:
Fix race condition in retrying migrations

During testing in the alternate host series, it was found that retries
when resizing an instance would always fail. This turned out to be true
even before alternate hosts for resize was introduced. Further
investigation showed that there was a race in call to retry the resize
and the revert of the original attempt.

This patch fixes that race condition, and updates the regression test to
reflect the correct results.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Closes-Bug #1741125

Change-Id: I12b4e1d9e50fefd81128df85d75bb34564f9da2c

[{'created': '2017-11-20 23:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Move aggregates from report client to ProviderTree

Previously SchedulerReportClient cached a private mapping of the
aggregate associations of each resource provider it knew about.  We're
going to want to give the virt driver the opportunity to query/update
aggregate associations when we pass it the ProviderTree, so this change
removes the cache from the SchedulerReportClient and uses the aggregate
affordance recently added to ProviderTree instead.

On the way, this also fixes a couple of memory leaks where we weren't
cleaning up the "last updated" cache.

commit_message:
Move aggregates from report client to ProviderTree

Previously SchedulerReportClient cached a private mapping of the
aggregate associations of each resource provider it knew about.  We're
going to want to give the virt driver the opportunity to query/update
aggregate associations when we pass it the ProviderTree, so this change
removes the cache from the SchedulerReportClient and uses the aggregate
affordance recently added to ProviderTree instead.

On the way, this also fixes a couple of memory leaks where we weren't
cleaning up the "last updated" cache.

Change-Id: I1e3b739692e6adebecd80ee8220f1d7b9790d80f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 09:52:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stable keepalived priorities

The calculation of the keepalived priority depended on the set of hosts
in the ansible_play_hosts variable. This meant that priorites changed
when the playbook was limited to only run on a subset of the hosts in
the "haproxy" group (eg. when reinstalling just one node).

This change replaces ansible_play_hosts by groups["haproxy"] so that the
priority calculation is stable as long as the set of haproxy nodes does
not change. It also simplifies the priority calculation without
changeing the result.

This change does not change the configuration in case the playbook is
run without --limit and ensures that the configuration does not change
if it is run with --limit.

Change-Id: I378351954fbed7b1fc31303c60e4575ddad9cf1d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-09 10:35:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stable keepalived priorities

in the ansible_play_hosts variable. This meant that priorites changed
when the playbook was limited to only run on a subset of the hosts in
the "haproxy" group (eg. when reinstalling just one node).

This change replaces ansible_play_hosts by groups["haproxy"] so that the
priority calculation is stable as long as the set of haproxy nodes does
not change. It also simplifies the priority calculation without
changeing the result.

This change does not change the configuration in case the playbook is
run without --limit and ensures that the configuration does not change
if it is run with --limit.

Change-Id: I378351954fbed7b1fc31303c60e4575ddad9cf1d
'}]
commit_message:
Stable keepalived priorities

The calculation of the keepalived priority depended on the set of hosts
in the ansible_play_hosts variable. This meant that priorites changed
when the playbook was limited to only run on a subset of the hosts in
the "haproxy" group (eg. when reinstalling just one node).

This change replaces ansible_play_hosts by groups["haproxy"] so that the
priority calculation is stable as long as the set of haproxy nodes does
not change. It also simplifies the priority calculation without
changeing the result.

This change does not change the configuration in case the playbook is
run without --limit and ensures that the configuration does not change
if it is run with --limit.

Change-Id: I378351954fbed7b1fc31303c60e4575ddad9cf1d

Madhuri,

Add support for Clear Container Runtime

This patch installs Clear Container[1] as one of the runtime
for docker.

[1] https://clearlinux.org/features/intel%C2%AE-clear-containers

Build Started http://10.24.20.18:30081/job/charts/job/openstack/job/openstack-helm/job/basic/2396/'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-01 10:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Successful 

http://12.37.173.196:32775/repository/att-comdev-jenkins-logs/openstack-helm/org.openstack.helm/2396/org.openstack.helm-2396.x-gtar : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2017-12-01 16:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Craig, I also agree this is some great helm templating work.  I have a quick question given this is certainly a challenge to mentally follow.  From browsing the code, it appears we work our way up the override chain with a `merge` which to me says that we will inherit.  In other words, the "default" overrides would be inherited if not specifically overridden further down rather then need to be re-input in their entirety for any particular specific override tree, whether that is a label or a particular host.  If this is indeed the case, I think we should call it out in the RST documentation and provide an example of that inheritance bubbling up from the "default" overrides to the label and host overrides.'}, {'account_id': 26686, 'date': '2017-12-01 18:14:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

That's correct. We coalesce each set of overrides with the non-overrides to produce a full representation of the config data for each one, and feed each of these to their own configmap, which in turn each have their own daemonset. For example if there are overrides for 2 hosts and 3 labels, 6 daemonsets will be generated (the 6th being the default daemonset that uses none of the overrides).

The `merge` function from the sprig library is the key thing that makes this possibile; it does a deep/recursive merge. A lot of the complexity is due to care required with merge, as it is very sensitive to the argument order (merging dicts the wrong way can cause an infinite loop) and how the data is put together prior to the merge.

Good idea, I'll make this update to the example in the doc."}, {'account_id': 26686, 'date': '2017-12-01 18:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-01 18:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started http://10.24.20.18:30081/job/charts/job/openstack/job/openstack-helm/job/basic/2404/'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-01 19:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Successful 

http://12.37.173.196:32775/repository/att-comdev-jenkins-logs/openstack-helm/org.openstack.helm/2404/org.openstack.helm-2404.x-gtar : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 26686, 'date': '2017-12-02 02:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-12-02 02:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Add support for node-level conf overrides

Add override functionality to helm-toolkit and enable in compute daemonset.

Change-Id: Ia85abbbea89c12d0b6f21ecf2413cd3ae7b9552e

commit_message:
Release ironic-tempest-plugin 1.0.0

This is the first ever release of ironic-tempest-plugin. It contains
the complete tempest test suite, migrated from ironic and ironic-inspector
source code trees. Setting version straight to 1.0.0 as it's already
used in the CI.

Change-Id: I5d831980be221a16d3cef535e121ebb2dc30d988

messages: [{'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-01-08 14:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-08 15:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nWe already have a 1.12.0 os-brick release, so even though it breaks semver versioning a little, this would have to be a 1.11.1 at this point.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-01-08 16:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-09 15:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

There have been numerous bugfixes and reuqirements
updates backported to stable/ocata.  This release of
os-brick releases those changes including fixes for
making close of volumes using luks idempotent.

Change-Id: Idf8b8305a31a360afbff39e74c74c36dc8a4c684
'}, {'created': '2018-01-08 16:52:49.000000000', 'message': "Release os-brick 1.11.1

There have been numerous bugfixes and reuqirements
updates backported to stable/ocata.  This release of
os-brick releases those changes including fixes for
making close of volumes using luks idempotent.

Normally these changes would come with a feature level
bump in numbering but that can't be done as it will
conflict with other already released os-brick versions.

Change-Id: Idf8b8305a31a360afbff39e74c74c36dc8a4c684
"}]
commit_message:
Release os-brick 1.11.1

There have been numerous bugfixes and reuqirements
updates backported to stable/ocata.  This release of
os-brick releases those changes including fixes for
making close of volumes using luks idempotent.

Normally these changes would come with a feature level
bump in numbering but that can't be done as it will
conflict with other already released os-brick versions.

Change-Id: Idf8b8305a31a360afbff39e74c74c36dc8a4c684

recheck ovb timeout'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-06 19:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to config-download-ha'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-07 07:49:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's only for jobs with network isolation, but what if job doesn't have it? It never was in templates, only in net-iso.yml file"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-08 12:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It's only for jobs with network isolation, but what if job doesn't
 > have it? It never was in templates, only in net-iso.yml file

If the job doesn't set the parameter, but it's needed, it's likely the job fails.

It never was in the net-iso.yml, not sure what you mean by that. Look here, it's not there:
https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/test-environments/net-iso.yaml

It is here though:
https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/test-environments/network-templates/network-environment.yaml#L16

Which is why this patch exists, to bring tripleo-heat-templates in line with tripleo-ci."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-08 13:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My question is - is it ok to have this configuration in non network isolation job?

Right, I meant network-environment.yaml.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-08 13:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo-experimental'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-08 13:06:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> My question is - is it ok to have this configuration in non network
 > isolation job?
 > 
 > Right, I meant network-environment.yaml.

Yes, it will be fine because non network isolation jobs won't be using this environment file."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-08 13:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-08 18:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-09 09:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-09 09:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}]

commit_message:
Add PublicVirtualFixedIPs to ci network-environment.yaml

This parameter must have been missed (or was adder later) when these
were templates were copied from tripleo-ci in
I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

Change-Id: Iccd871647f44f9ebad7319c664d45188c42c4aae

commit_message:
Only execute UI validations when UI is enabled

One can disable the UI, and the validation will fail if it's not there.

Change-Id: I7a3e317705c95e3ca368eacb376d88c426f72d54

commit_message:
split baremetal playbook

Separate quickstart baremetal playbook into smaller
playbooks that follow the same breakpoints as the libvirt playbook in
tripleo-quickstart-extras.

This is part of the preparations to convert CI to follow the step by
step workflow the users will follow to reproduce CI

commit_message:
Release ironic-inspector 7.0.0 for Queens

The major version bump is because of removing of the in-tree
tempest plugin code.

[{'created': '2017-11-24 06:55:18.000000000', 'message': 'Kaminario K2: Support duplicated FQDN in network

The Kaminario K2 driver uses the FQDN of the node that is doing the
attach as an unique identifier to map the volume.

The problem is that the FQDN is not always unique, there are
environments where the same FQDN can be found in different systems, and
in those cases if both try to attach volumes the second system will
fail.

One example of this happening would be on a QA environment where you are
creating VMs and they all have names like controller-0.localdomain and
compute-0.localdomain.

This patch adds a configuration option to the K2 driver called
`unique_fqdn_network` to support these kind of environments.

Closes-Bug: #1720147
Change-Id: I2099b804a2043078e50a5a9e14c1497861576f61

commit_message:
Kaminario K2: Support duplicated FQDN in network

The Kaminario K2 driver uses the FQDN of the node that is doing the
attach as an unique identifier to map the volume.

The problem is that the FQDN is not always unique, there are
environments where the same FQDN can be found in different systems, and
in those cases if both try to attach volumes the second system will
fail.

One example of this happening would be on a QA environment where you are
creating VMs and they all have names like controller-0.localdomain and
compute-0.localdomain.

This patch adds a configuration option to the K2 driver called
`unique_fqdn_network` to support these kind of environments.

Closes-Bug: #1720147
Change-Id: I2099b804a2043078e50a5a9e14c1497861576f61
(cherry picked from commit baa8626eac9c975b719c03274d42b54ce3de74fe)

commit_message:
systemd: Use ceph-mon unit during upgrades

The monitor bootstrap code uses the ceph-mon systemd unit (instead
of the ceph-mon@ systemd unit); ensure that the monitor upgrade
code uses ceph-mon as well otherwise ceph-mon daemons are not
restarted during a managed upgrade.

Change-Id: I6ca7c5c7ca8cf3a62a5ee3209f14c059c0eec9be
Closes-Bug: 1742082

commit_message:
Allow NetworkManager to work (if present)

This patch adds tasks that check to see if NetworkManager is
installed and running. If it is, the tasks allow NetworkManager
to handle the `lxcbr0` interface.

In addition, the `NetworkManager-wait-online.service` will be
enabled to ensure that all services that depend on networking will
wait for network configuration to be completed.

Partial-Bug: 1738467
Change-Id: I415241daccf22f03826062eea18b3b36b2d9e53e

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

Change-Id: I06ce722ffc28f8f2f5f5ac022c1d707267759b8d

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

Change-Id: I4780a19158709495ffcaae8fc2f1a1d45f51fd9c

commit_message:
Gate: Deploy HWE kernel on ubuntu hosts

This PS deploys the HWE kernel on Ubuntu Hosts, which is required
for CephFS:
 * https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/external-storage/issues/345

Change-Id: I2ebd46eadf5a4c7a857d42302f388511691ab0db

commit_message:
Update README and setup.cfg, initial version of usage guide

* Set setup.cfg URL to the (future) documentation link
* Remove Python 3.3 and 3.4 support, leave only 3.5
* Update README with actual information
* Include README in index.rst as an introduction
* Very basic usage guide, mostly links to Tempest docs
* Switch links to HTTPS

Depends-On: If130b765604d606420a4877a548e82d311ef7b9b
Change-Id: Idacf84322773e40eaaa6346dc062291578876a1d

commit_message:
systemd: Ensure ceph-osd.target called during upgrade

For systemd based installations, ceph-osd.target should be restarted
instead of ceph-osd-all (an upstart configuration) to ensure that
all ceph-osd processes are restarted in the event that no directory
ownership changes need to take place during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I893e440ec90d1f74b52cedb84c332b0ec57f74fe
Closes-Bug: 1742120

commit_message:
upgrade: correct permissions for ceph-mon dirs

Ensure that the directory in /var/lib/ceph/mon for the local
mon unit is user writable, ensuring that ceph-mon daemons
>= Luminous are able to start.

Closes-Bug: 1742083

Change-Id: I9cac4bd258b7038738a693329588420696eac703

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 13:51:41.000000000', 'message': 'tests: improve idempotency and isolation

Use sort_keys when serializing in json format for idempotency under
Python 3; Mock out calls to get_osds in broker test to ensure that
a local install of ceph-common does not cause unit test failures.

Change-Id: I6ce4075fd38e8431372a359cc88332d2da7a3974
'}]
commit_message:
tests: improve idempotency and isolation

Use sort_keys when serializing in json format for idempotency under
Python 3; Mock out calls to get_osds in broker test to ensure that
a local install of ceph-common does not cause unit test failures.

Change-Id: I6ce4075fd38e8431372a359cc88332d2da7a3974

commit_message:
Move instackenv.json copy to ovb-create-stack task

This review moves the actions to copy the instackenv.json
to /root from undercloud-setup to the ovb-create-stack task
so that these actions follow the same workflow as the
toci-scripts.

Change-Id: I5029753a665937ae7e0c596cf23944a573c8e22f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 07:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

Change-Id: Ib4a3a8ed8748bd06dca7a228e4f085074b5fbcad
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

Change-Id: Ib4a3a8ed8748bd06dca7a228e4f085074b5fbcad

commit_message:
Allow for optinal volumes and env variables

This patch will allow to attach optional volumes and env variables to the
neutron-api, heat-api and nova-compute containers.

Change-Id: I95cd5017fdbbec257d274b805be4509ec32f9019
Closes-Bug: 1741464

Adding it to skip list until find the root cause.

Related-Bug: 1741850

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 16:15:00.000000000', 'message': 'fix linkcheck tox target

The current linkcheck tox target fails on a fresh neutron-lib clone
due to the /modules not existing under doc/source/reference. This patch
fixes the issue by ensuring the modules are generated before running
the linkcheck target.

Change-Id: Ie55b855c9469435b6f8ef4b3459c3082860f93c0
'}]
commit_message:
fix linkcheck tox target

The current linkcheck tox target fails on a fresh neutron-lib clone
due to the /modules not existing under doc/source/reference. This patch
fixes the issue by ensuring the modules are generated before running
the linkcheck target.

Change-Id: Ie55b855c9469435b6f8ef4b3459c3082860f93c0

Mark thanks for the patch, I know without implemented neutron notifications it is useless but we should honor physnet awareness when do port binding ie update get_switch_device () to filter switches by physnet if specified. https://github.com/openstack/networking-generic-switch/blob/86cdb743f716b5a0539f71b4791f041ecdaf48f2/networking_generic_switch/devices/utils.py#L16'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2017-12-04 14:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-12-04 14:43:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

 > notifications it is useless but we should honor physnet awareness

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 13:37:09.000000000', 'message': "Add physical network awareness

Ironic added support for physical network awareness [1] in the pike
release. With multiple physical networks it is possible that each
physical network extends over a subset of the devices in a network.
Further, the segmentation ID space on different physical networks may
overlap.

This change adds support for configuration of a set of physical networks
on each switch. On neutron network creation and deletion, NGS will only
(de)provision VLANs on devices tagged with that network's physical
network. If a device is not tagged with any physical networks, the old
behaviour of provisioning all networks on all devices is used.

Configuration of physical networks is be via a new per-device config
option, ngs_physical_networks:

[genericswitch:switch1]
device_type = acme
ip = 1.2.3.4
username = bob
password = drowssap
ngs_physical_networks = physnet1,physnet2

[1]
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/physical-network-awareness.html

Change-Id: I77a8247f6152fd0133c8f5a325ca20cd35fa669d
Closes-Bug: #1735394

commit_message:
Add physical network awareness

Ironic added support for physical network awareness [1] in the pike
release. With multiple physical networks it is possible that each
physical network extends over a subset of the devices in a network.
Further, the segmentation ID space on different physical networks may
overlap.

This change adds support for configuration of a set of physical networks
on each switch. On neutron network creation and deletion, NGS will only
(de)provision VLANs on devices tagged with that network's physical
network. If a device is not tagged with any physical networks, the old
behaviour of provisioning all networks on all devices is used.

Configuration of physical networks is be via a new per-device config
option, ngs_physical_networks:

[genericswitch:switch1]
device_type = acme
ip = 1.2.3.4
username = bob
password = drowssap
ngs_physical_networks = physnet1,physnet2

[1]
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/physical-network-awareness.html

Change-Id: I77a8247f6152fd0133c8f5a325ca20cd35fa669d
Closes-Bug: #1735394

[{'created': '2018-01-08 22:45:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix traceback on newly created empty builders

If you create a new ring and they try to display it we blow up
(unreleased regression introduced in the related change).

When can raise an EmptyRingError if we try to calculate balance on a
builder with an empty dev list, a dev list with all devices removed, or
a dev list with all devices with zero weight.

We've tried a few different LBYL patterns to keep tracebacks off the
command line, but we seem to be finally coming around to EAFP and just
catch the EmptyRingError.

Related-Change-Id: I483b1f622d8211ee81caebb5995afb331ec3a405
Change-Id: I483b1f622d8211ee81caebb5995afb331ec3a405
"}]
commit_message:
Fix traceback on newly created empty builders

If you create a new ring and they try to display it we blow up
(unreleased regression introduced in the related change).

When can raise an EmptyRingError if we try to calculate balance on a
builder with an empty dev list, a dev list with all devices removed, or
a dev list with all devices with zero weight.

We've tried a few different LBYL patterns to keep tracebacks off the
command line, but we seem to be finally coming around to EAFP and just
catch the EmptyRingError.

Related-Change-Id: I483b1f622d8211ee81caebb5995afb331ec3a405
Change-Id: I483b1f622d8211ee81caebb5995afb331ec3a405

commit_message:
Ignore floating IP port for (create, update)_port

Creating/Updating LSP for floating IP is unnecessary in OVN.
It introduced a race condition bug.

Change-Id: I380686d21314095c39d7d1a2a4eea3e21dbe7c9d
Closes-bug: #1734819
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7d73643c82bef58d9f40173f76834174b11f3312)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 05:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Use only base publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job

The publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job is marked as final: true

The publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-[neutron|horizon] templates are
adding to required-projects, which is therefore silently failing as
the job can not be modified.  I think there was a zuul bug previously
that allowed this, which is probably why we didn't notice.

I think the job wants to be final: as it is doing the publishing.  I
also think the project shouldn't be required for doc publishing; we're
trying to get away from having dependencies for docs.  Convert these
to use the base job (even if the jobs fail, at least zuul will try to
run then ... currently the only message for these POST jobs is put
into the zuul logs silently).

Needed-By: Id1c6d334e314382bdff05b27e4a7421cfab0c94e
Change-Id: I57ace5de5fd36efe2e513674734e97a0048743b6
"}]
commit_message:
Use only base publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job

The publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job is marked as final: true

The publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-[neutron|horizon] templates are
adding to required-projects, which is therefore silently failing as
the job can not be modified.  I think there was a zuul bug previously
that allowed this, which is probably why we didn't notice.

I think the job wants to be final: as it is doing the publishing.  I
also think the project shouldn't be required for doc publishing; we're
trying to get away from having dependencies for docs.  Convert these
to use the base job (even if the jobs fail, at least zuul will try to
run then ... currently the only message for these POST jobs is put
into the zuul logs silently).

Needed-By: Id1c6d334e314382bdff05b27e4a7421cfab0c94e
Change-Id: I57ace5de5fd36efe2e513674734e97a0048743b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 10:25:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix test with OVS example failed case when exec ovs-vsctl add-port

I'm trying to do the test acording to the dev-quickstart.rst
when exec bash ~/networking-generic-switch/devstack/exercise.sh
the following error happened:
ovs-vsctl: Error detected while setting up 'p_01'.
See ovs-vswitchd log for details.
here is the failed command:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01
the root cause is that the port's name should be a exist interface
use ifconfig to see, such as eth0. If you just want to use a virtual
port name to make a test you should specify the port's type like
ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01 set Interface port0 type=internal
so I changed the command as following
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_03  set Interface p_03 type=internal
this time it worked for me.
Closes-Bug: #1741222

Change-Id: I6416a06f29151c6b068e616ccdc5be18a608b9b6
"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 10:30:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix test with OVS example failed case when exec ovs-vsctl add-port

the following error happened:
ovs-vsctl: Error detected while setting up 'p_01'.
See ovs-vswitchd log for details.
here is the failed command:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01
the root cause is that the port's name should be a exist interface
use ifconfig to see, such as eth0. If you just want to use a virtual
port name to make a test you should specify the port's type like
ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01 set Interface port0 type=internal
so I changed the command as following
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01  set Interface p_01 type=internal
this time it worked for me.
Closes-Bug: #1741222

Change-Id: I6416a06f29151c6b068e616ccdc5be18a608b9b6
"}, {'created': '2018-01-09 10:01:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix test with OVS example failed case when exec ovs-vsctl add-port

When exec bash ~/networking-generic-switch/devstack/exercise.sh
according to the dev-quickstart.rst
the following error happened:
ovs-vsctl: Error detected while setting up 'p_01': could not open
network device p_01 (No such device).
See ovs-vswitchd log for details.

Here is the failed command:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01

the root cause is that the port's name should be a exist interface
use ifconfig to see, such as eth0. If we just want to use a virtual
port name to make a test we should specify the port's type like
ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01 set Interface port0 type=internal
After changed the command as following:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01  set Interface p_01 type=internal
the error message gone away.
Closes-Bug: #1741222

Change-Id: I6416a06f29151c6b068e616ccdc5be18a608b9b6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test with OVS example failed case when exec ovs-vsctl add-port

When exec bash ~/networking-generic-switch/devstack/exercise.sh
according to the dev-quickstart.rst
the following error happened:
ovs-vsctl: Error detected while setting up 'p_01': could not open
network device p_01 (No such device).
See ovs-vswitchd log for details.

Here is the failed command:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01

the root cause is that the port's name should be a exist interface
use ifconfig to see, such as eth0. If we just want to use a virtual
port name to make a test we should specify the port's type like
ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01 set Interface port0 type=internal
After changed the command as following:
sudo ovs-vsctl add-port genericswitch p_01  set Interface p_01 type=internal
the error message gone away.
Closes-Bug: #1741222

Change-Id: I6416a06f29151c6b068e616ccdc5be18a608b9b6

commit_message:
Treat doc warnings as errors

With the switch to build-sphinx, the setting to treat warnings
as errors was missed. This adds the -W flag to bring back this
setting.

Also cleaning out doc related settings from setup.cfg as they
are no longer being used.

Change-Id: Ic45deb8acdebc53f7cad98eb5c9fd9388929eee9

commit_message:
Treat doc warnings as errors

This adds a flag to the sphinx-build command to treat warnings
as errors.

It also cleans out the old doc related entries from setup.cfg
since docs are no longer built using that method.

Change-Id: I1bacf231605ab791d4b817223ab64be2a4133672

Centralize config options

Consolidate all config options under ``conf`` directory.

New config modules should give a better picture of the configuration
options provided by the inspector.

commit_message:
Allow InternalClient to container/object listing with prefix

This patch adds 'prefix' argument to iter_containers/iter_objects
method of InternalClient.
This change will be used in general task queue feature [1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389/

Change-Id: I8c2067c07fe35681fdc9403da771f451c21136d3

[{'created': '2018-01-05 16:03:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add regression test for resizing failing during retries

During testing in the alternate host series, it was found that retries
when resizing an instance would always fail. This turned out to be true
even before alternate hosts for resize was introduced. Further
investigation showed that there was a race in call to retry the resize
and the revert of the original attempt.

This adds a functional regression test to show the failure. A follow up
patch with the fix will modify the test to show it passing again.

Related-Bug: 1741125

Change-Id: I0760f3e3bc447c39a6443afd7857046a08b8f01d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-08 15:55:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add regression test for resize failing during retries

when resizing an instance would always fail. This turned out to be true
even before alternate hosts for resize was introduced. Further
investigation showed that there was a race in call to retry the resize
and the revert of the original attempt.

This adds a functional regression test to show the failure. A follow up

Related-Bug: 1741125

Change-Id: I0760f3e3bc447c39a6443afd7857046a08b8f01d
'}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for resize failing during retries

During testing in the alternate host series, it was found that retries
when resizing an instance would always fail. This turned out to be true
even before alternate hosts for resize was introduced. Further
investigation showed that there was a race in call to retry the resize
and the revert of the original attempt.

This adds a functional regression test to show the failure. A follow up
patch with the fix will modify the test to show it passing again.

Related-Bug: 1741125

Change-Id: I0760f3e3bc447c39a6443afd7857046a08b8f01d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 17:49:47.000000000', 'message': "Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856
(cherry picked from commit 1706e3989157f912bce99beb99c75216a064eb2d)
(cherry picked from commit 344029b94ad7ff4667403a851d33c3ddb4e97b4b)
(cherry picked from commit b00b2fe9be4394e7c9cf73c168d435a2333d12f6)
"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 15:02:28.000000000', 'message': "Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over

stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856
(cherry picked from commit 1706e3989157f912bce99beb99c75216a064eb2d)
(cherry picked from commit 344029b94ad7ff4667403a851d33c3ddb4e97b4b)
(cherry picked from commit b00b2fe9be4394e7c9cf73c168d435a2333d12f6)
"}]
commit_message:
Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856
(cherry picked from commit 1706e3989157f912bce99beb99c75216a064eb2d)
(cherry picked from commit 344029b94ad7ff4667403a851d33c3ddb4e97b4b)
(cherry picked from commit b00b2fe9be4394e7c9cf73c168d435a2333d12f6)

commit_message:
Add should_bind_port property to NetworkInterface

The property defines if network interface should perform port binding
and is a trigger to check that port contains needed for information.
Will become @abstractproperty in Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1662446
Change-Id: I98a602da566be2c7f48bb61cbeafe784a73b0743

commit_message:
FlashSystems: permit snapshot/clone volumes larger than source

Permit clone volumes and volumes created from snapshots to
be larger than their source volumes; implemented in response
to failures in the following CI tests:
  * VolumesSnapshotTestJSON.test_volume_from_snapshot
  * VolumesCloneTest.test_create_from_volume

Change-Id: I21511e5c4db62563c61815c1671e8bb44ad3f427
Closes-Bug: #1560655
(cherry picked from commit 927367cd9af6adf260bea4da4dcc5cc94eaa7b13)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 07:54:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "-y" option for package install command.

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package, or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: Ic126b54a400fff145ee8336780a395e1e48a566d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "-y" option for package install command.

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package, or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: Ic126b54a400fff145ee8336780a395e1e48a566d

commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-functional

Instead of self-defining a job named tox-functional - and violating the
naming conventions this way - let's use the elsewhere defined common job
openstack-tox-functional.

Change-Id: I6ce2d511f0b3034989d16d8530667c134a3bf900

subject: Support existing builders with None _last_part_moves
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-08 21:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-08 23:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Nice, yeah, I think having any disperion when not having any previously is a great reason to save :)

Also nice fixes for dealing with older legacy builders.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-08 23:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

this FTW!

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/bin/swift-ring-builder", line 6, in <module>
        exec(compile(open(__file__).read(), __file__, 'exec'))
      File "/vagrant/swift/bin/swift-ring-builder", line 24, in <module>
        sys.exit(main())
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/cli/ringbuilder.py", line 1516, in main
        getattr(Commands, command, Commands.unknown)()

        parts, balance, removed_devs = builder.rebalance(seed=get_seed(3))
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/ring/builder.py", line 511, in rebalance
        self._update_last_part_moves()
      File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/ring/builder.py", line 933, in _update_last_part_moves

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 21:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'Support existing builders with None _last_part_moves

These were likely written before the first related change, or created
from an existing ring file.

Also, tolerate missing dispersion when rebalancing -- that may not exist
in the builder file.

Change-Id: I26e3b4429c747c23206e4671f7c86543bb182a15
Related-Change: Ib165cf974c865d47c2d9e8f7b3641971d2e9f404
Related-Change: Ie239b958fc7e0547ffda2bebf61546bd4ef3d829
Related-Change: I551fcaf274876861feb12848749590f220842d68
'}]
commit_message:
Support existing builders with None _last_part_moves

These were likely written before the first related change, or created
from an existing ring file.

Also, tolerate missing dispersion when rebalancing -- that may not exist
in the builder file.

Change-Id: I26e3b4429c747c23206e4671f7c86543bb182a15
Related-Change: Ib165cf974c865d47c2d9e8f7b3641971d2e9f404
Related-Change: Ie239b958fc7e0547ffda2bebf61546bd4ef3d829
Related-Change: I551fcaf274876861feb12848749590f220842d68

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git source url

Documentation not located in 'doc/source' directory needs the
giturl value to make the source url correct.

Change-Id: I772a66de4680ba73ed79f8ea5481d6900f71fa82
Closes-Bug: #1732630

commit_message:
Add get_session function to base action class

This removes some duplication and can be reused in a future patch
switching the ansible action to use the TripleoInventory class.

Change-Id: I5278ec75c2ff714c148901f723fb6ef5e1327f49

commit_message:
Publish ironic-tempest-plugin releases to pypi

Note that due to pypi changes projects no longer have to be pre-registered.
It will be registered on the next release.

Change-Id: I0db600faba024517eb25a31b275771d6f5cf0299

Current workflow for VNF create with configuration is:

This workflow appears to update the device after the device

commit_message:
Modify the create workflow for vnf with config management

Current workflow for VNF create with configuration is:
PENDING_CREATE->ACTIVE->PENDING_UPDATE->ACTIVE.

This workflow appears to update the device after the device
is ACTIVE (created) which trips the user to think the device
is getting updated again.

Modify the workflow as:
PENDING_CREATE->CONFIGURATION_UPDATE->ACTIVE for vnf create
with configuration.
So
1. Remove the duplicate mgmt_call in plugin file which
invokes the mgmt driver twice to update the configuration.

2. Refactor the plugin file to remove the update_device
call from create_device which duplicates all previous operations.

Closes-bug: #1600412

Change-Id: Ib995a2910bb7839483906f09217dff7a1e66f403

in globals.yml. Default set to False.

commit_message:
Upgrade assertion tags only apply to services

Upgrade assertion tags required that the deliverable had a
'type:service' entry in the YAML, which was removed later.

Replace this requirement by text describing which deliverables
may apply. Clarify some confusing usage of 'project' in
the same paragraphs.

NB: Current usage of those tags match the new requirements.

Change-Id: Icff819cd3d1a4107fad5f18cb9e3c4a22ea58e2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 07:37:10.000000000', 'message': "Add ComputeNode.virt_type field

Currently, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is 'QEMU', no matter whether
KVM or QEMU is used for libvirt backend. This is because both KVM and
QEMU guests are serviced by the same driver for qemu:// URI in libvirt.

Similary, ComputeNode.supported_hv_specs field has hypervisor_type
infomation about which type (e.g. KVM or both KVM and QEMU) of guests
are supported by the hypervisor, but it doesn't supply information
about which virt_type is set to that compute node. This means we have
no way to know which type of guests are going to be built in that
compute node from the ComputeNode object.

For this reason, this patch adds ComputeNode.virt_type field, which
holds a value passed by operators to each compute node via nova.conf.

Partial-Bug: #1195361
Change-Id: I192f9468163c5ec9d88c5efeea08369021829ae8
"}]
commit_message:
Add ComputeNode.virt_type field

Currently, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is 'QEMU', no matter whether
KVM or QEMU is used for libvirt backend. This is because both KVM and
QEMU guests are serviced by the same driver for qemu:// URI in libvirt.

Similary, ComputeNode.supported_hv_specs field has hypervisor_type
infomation about which type (e.g. KVM or both KVM and QEMU) of guests
are supported by the hypervisor, but it doesn't supply information
about which virt_type is set to that compute node. This means we have
no way to know which type of guests are going to be built in that
compute node from the ComputeNode object.

For this reason, this patch adds ComputeNode.virt_type field, which
holds a value passed by operators to each compute node via nova.conf.

Partial-Bug: #1195361
Change-Id: I192f9468163c5ec9d88c5efeea08369021829ae8

commit_message:
Bind-mount iscsid IQN by its real host path

Containerized or running on baremetal services
on a node must use the same iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN).
However, overcloud nodes must have a unique IQN.

Tht's puppet config bind mounts the real hosts' /etc/iscsid
directory so that puppet ensures the IQN is unique and
is reset once, and only once.

Switch the host path bind mount for cinder bundles to catch up
that configuration path as well.

Related-bug: #1735425

Change-Id: I7e9f0641164691682516ac3e72e2145c7d112409
Co-authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Martin Andr <m.andre@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-30 14:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-30 17:40:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-01 16:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It seems to me you need to apply the same change to the other services mounting /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/:
- docker/services/cinder-backup.yaml
- docker/services/cinder-volume.yaml
- docker/services/multipathd.yaml
- docker/services/nova-compute.yaml
- docker/services/nova-ironic.yaml
- docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-backup.yaml
- docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml

And also in puppet-tripleo:
- manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/backup_bundle.pp
- manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/volume_bundle.pp'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-01 16:58:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@mandre @bogdando but should we even be doing this? I may have missed some context or discussion but i thought the config generated by docker-puppet.py should indeed be under /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/ . So i'm still a bit puzzled why this is needed. And what would it take to, instead of mounting /etc/, make the config files indeed land under /var/lib/config-data/ where we wanted them."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I traced the change to I1cbcb858754cc4792a085438eb28f2476245228c that according to the commit msg fixes an issue with mixed BM and containerized services using the IQN. Looks like the easiest solution was to bind mount /etc/iscsid in the container generating the iscsid configs.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-05 08:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

right. Although I'm not sure if adding /etc/iscsid host-path volume for puppet config steps really addresses an empty /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/ used in *docker_config*"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-05 08:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Alan, could you please comment on this ^^ ?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-05 10:37:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> right. Although I'm not sure if adding /etc/iscsid host-path volume
 > for puppet config steps really addresses an empty /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/
 > used in *docker_config*

I1cbcb858754cc4792a085438eb28f2476245228c most certainly does not address the empty /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/ but *causes* it.

My preference would be to bind mount /etc/iscsid/ in puppet_config and instead run task that copies /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/etc/iscsid to /etc/iscsid on the host, possibly via a throw away container."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-05 10:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > right. Although I'm not sure if adding /etc/iscsid host-path
 > volume
 > > for puppet config steps really addresses an empty
 > /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/
 > > used in *docker_config*
 > 
 > I1cbcb858754cc4792a085438eb28f2476245228c most certainly does not
 > address the empty /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/ but
 > *causes* it.
 > 
 > My preference would be to bind mount /etc/iscsid/ in puppet_config
 > and instead run task that copies /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/etc/iscsid
 > to /etc/iscsid on the host, possibly via a throw away container.

humm if I forget words it's more difficult to understand: "My preference would be to *stop bind mounting* /etc/iscsid/ in puppet_config"'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I want to start by restating the requirements, which relate to the IQN stored in /etc/iscsi/initiatorname.iscsi.

- All services using iSCSI on a node, whether they are running on baremetal or in a container, must use the same IQN. This means they all need read access to the same data.

- Every overcloud node needs a unique IQN. Prior to Pike, where everything ran on baremetal, each node inherited the IQN from the common overcloud image. Code was added to puppet-tripleo to reset the IQN.

- Once an IQN has been reset, it should not be reset again. If the IQN is allowed to change a second time during an update/upgrade then things will break.

The first and third points explain the motive behind I1cbcb858754cc4792a085438eb28f2476245228c, and I'm surprised CI didn't detect the errors that this patch needs to resolve.

I think there are two choices on how to meet these requirements:

1) bind mount /etc/iscsi:/etc/iscis:ro in all containers that use iSCSI

2) Change this file's puppet_config so it leaves artifacts in /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid, and provide access to other containers. But do that in a way that a) updates the baremetal IQN if it needs to be updated, and b) does NOT update the baremetal IQN if it had been previously reset (see [1]).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/base/iscsid.pp#L37"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

my vote goes for the #1 :)'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> my vote goes for the #1 :)

Alright this seems reasonable to limit the scope and re-use the logic we already have in puppet, but IMO this warrants a comment at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524187/1/docker/services/iscsid.yaml@70 to explain this dark magic.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for inputs, will update the patch shortly'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for adding the comment, it looks good.

Back to my first comment, we need to apply the same change to the other services mounting /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/iscsid/:

    docker/services/cinder-backup.yaml
    docker/services/cinder-volume.yaml
    docker/services/multipathd.yaml
    docker/services/nova-compute.yaml
    docker/services/nova-ironic.yaml
    docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-backup.yaml
    docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml

And also in puppet-tripleo:

    manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/backup_bundle.pp
    manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/volume_bundle.pp'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:44:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not sure if this one has to depend on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526390/ or otherwise"}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks Bogdan, good catch for the missing iscsid_config puppet tag.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-12-07 14:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-12-07 14:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I want to put the brakes on long enough to check something. My understanding is _only_ the iscsid container needs write access to the host's /etc/iscsi directory. I commented the cinder-backup.yaml may not need to have that mount in its puppet_config, and the same comment applies to the other (non-iscsid) containers.

But maybe I don't understand something, specifically the puppet-tag stuff."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-12-07 14:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix puppet config volume for iscsid in containers

Bind mount the /etc/iscsi host path for iscsi container puppet config.
Use the real host path /etc/iscsi for containers dependsing on it.

Closes-bug: #1735425

Change-Id: I838427ccae06cfe1be72939c4bcc2978f7dc36a8
Depends-on: I7e9f0641164691682516ac3e72e2145c7d112409
Co-authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Martin Andr <m.andre@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2017-07-11 18:57:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP Advocate more strongly for users to use shade

We get complaints that OpenStack is hard to use, which may result in
telling people to use the per-service python client libraries. We have
a library that is intended to be used by end-users and which tends to be
liked by its users. Let's lead with it in our user docs, and update the
examples to show using it, instead of showing using client libs
themselves.

NOTE: There are 5 more documents to go through and update, so this isn't
quite done.

Change-Id: I10965964126020cf8996a6fe02ae59824246d02c
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Advocate more strongly for users to use shade

We get complaints that OpenStack is hard to use, which may result in
telling people to use the per-service python client libraries. We have
a library that is intended to be used by end-users and which tends to be
liked by its users. Let's lead with it in our user docs, and update the
examples to show using it, instead of showing using client libs
themselves.

NOTE: There are 5 more documents to go through and update, so this isn't
quite done.

Change-Id: I10965964126020cf8996a6fe02ae59824246d02c

Horizon multidomain flag

Added horizon_keystone_multidomain flag. It can be now overriden
in globals.yml. Default set to False.

Support pxe uefi mode following guide
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-pxe.html

In the meantime, ironic-agent kernel and initramfs does not have to
be provided as precondition under /etc/kolla/config in such mode.
Add condition check as well.

commit_message:
ironic-pxe: support pxe uefi mode

Support pxe uefi mode following guide
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-pxe.html

In the meantime, ironic-agent kernel and initramfs does not have to
be provided as precondition under /etc/kolla/config in such mode.
Add condition check as well.

Change-Id: Ieefcf5f9fe839eab63f3fe4a1c5cf845f4fd4eb5
Signed-off-by: Zhangfei Gao <zhangfei.gao@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Revert "Add support for monasca-ui metrics API proxy"

This change breaks the devstack installation. The Monasca datasource
cannot connect with Monasca API. I'm reverting until fixed.

t=2017-12-21T15:27:04+0000 lvl=info msg="Proxying call to [http://192.168.10.6:8070/v2.0/metrics/names]"
t=2017-12-21T15:27:04+0000 lvl=info msg="Request Completed" logger=context userId=2 orgId=2 uname=mini-mon method=GET path=/v2.0/metrics/names status=401 remote_addr=192.168.10.1 time_ms=3ns size=114

This reverts commit bb5178406c03d37a957b64ef59c61ecdec504fc3.

Change-Id: Ie544c50fa817dbce0865c8885b33312be6d37ccf

commit_message:
Fix auto-detect crash on monasca-setup when using oslo.config

monasca_setup.detection.utils.load_oslo_configuration() should ignore
options to `from_cmd` that is not oslo.config built-in options. We are
only interested in the options --config-file and --config-dir.

Change-Id: I72dc53d8ee6dc7b0784e6931a19c461cdb322851
Story: 2001303
Task: 5854
(cherry picked from commit 089d8c4e421c9723786ff823e5e4628a825a7f73)

openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect git.openstack.org source URL

Docs that do not locate in doc/source directoy, after clicking the
bug report button of the docs.o.o pages, the pre-filled information
contains a incorrect git.openstack.org source URL. According to
openstackdocstheme[1], we should set "giturl" option in the "conf.py"
file of these docs.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L104

Change-Id: If9cd4bba7c451425d02e2927b814670904fdcb9c
Related-Bug: #1732630

commit_message:
Add the gnocchi_backend_storage configuration for external ceph docs

when use external ceph, kolla need set ceph to "no",this way by default, the
gnocchi_backend_storage will be file, refer to [0]. we should set
it to ceph, this patch to explain in docs.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/etc/kolla/globals.yml#L302

Change-Id: If35082531e9de4524299fe4fc7e97bec5a6c2c79

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary steps for user quickstart doc

It does not seem to be useful to clone ansible code from git, just copy
the config file. But if the versions do not match, is there a problem? It
is unclear why here need to copy the latest configuration file separately,
and if there are specific reasons, there should be specific instructions,
otherwise it is very confusing here. So I remove this part.

Change-Id: I5007e0f2d5c6c41741b2556c2466dd80037565e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 16:58:45.000000000', 'message': 'Remove explicit bindep parameters

All of these invocations of the bindep role are passing what amount to
the defaults. In zuul-jobs, doing bindep_dir: "{{ zuul_work_dir }}" is
important because it allows in-repo uses of those jobs to override how
they work for things like triggering from one repo but running on
another.

The publication jobs in project-config do not need that level of
flexibility, so just remove params and let defaults take over.

As a follow up, we could also add defaults for zuul_work_dir - and
honestly for bindep_dir - to the base job. That way we can always count
on them being set to a sane default value, and they're still
overrideable in a job.

Change-Id: I5bcda84aefa4726d0a904e8bc9698c21ca07f9a5
'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 21:18:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove explicit bindep parameters

All of these invocations of the bindep role are passing what amount to

The publication jobs in project-config do not need that level of

As a follow up, we could also add defaults for zuul_work_dir - and
honestly for bindep_dir - to the base job. That way we can always count

overrideable in a job.

Change-Id: I5bcda84aefa4726d0a904e8bc9698c21ca07f9a5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove explicit bindep parameters

All of these invocations of the bindep role are passing what amount to
the defaults. In zuul-jobs, doing bindep_dir: "{{ zuul_work_dir }}" is
important because it allows in-repo uses of those jobs to override how
they work for things like triggering from one repo but running on
another.

The publication jobs in project-config do not need that level of
flexibility, so just remove params and let defaults take over.

As a follow up, we could also add defaults for zuul_work_dir - and
honestly for bindep_dir - to the base job. That way we can always count
on them being set to a sane default value, and they're still
overrideable in a job.

Change-Id: I5bcda84aefa4726d0a904e8bc9698c21ca07f9a5

commit_message:
Backups restore allow name or uuid null

Since Idd6c6be1c8bdf4dcf730f67e75a58a0329fe5259 this commit add the
jsonschema validation for backup restore, restore a volume using null
name or uuid will failed. This breaks the original process.
This patch allow restore volume with null name and uuid.

Change-Id: I73442f1002d2784ecf7d50cdc49b31246cfc55f5
