commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for compute module (part 3)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the compute module. This
PS handles the last 11 modules for compute.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I0f8d249d58d7c6ad6f1d2fde2b52aefda10c64c4

commit_message:
Add missing tempest tests for listing and showing objects

This patch adds missing tempest tests for listing, showing and deleting
bgpvpns, network, and router associations. The project's tempest tests
now cover all CR(U)D operations for these objects which simplifies
inclusion in the upcoming OpenStack NFV interop program.

Closes-Bug: 1737773
Change-Id: Ib053be9e84ca1533f844447c48b291db9806edfb

commit_message:
change how drivers indicate support for an extension

This change will allow easier testing of extensions, by
avoiding the current behavior where the dummy driver
used for unit tests overwrites the
supported_extension_aliases of the plugin, which has a side
effect that the modified supported_extension_aliases can
affects other tests.

Change-Id: Ibcf9adfd1127940da6b390e924bda16561861d2d

commit_message:
Show the correct ptr record instead of the first one

Instead of calling _get_floatingip() and discarding its results, update
the list of fips that we want to return accordingly.

Change-Id: I05e8e2fb1677a4d53c4484cccec73b318a039007
Closes-Bug: 1731253
(cherry picked from commit 050a3752b5164cc0ad78fa8d87b57777358c40e7)

commit_message:
Use appropriate exception in StackResource.get_output()

Don't raise InvalidTemplateAttribute in StackResource.get_output() when an
output does not exist - it's not the case that get_output() is only used
for fetching attributes. Instead, raise NotFound from get_output(), and
translate that to InvalidTemplateAttribute in the caller when we are
actually fetching an attribute.

Change-Id: I4f883e4b583a965785d0a595c8c33b47dc94118c
Related-Bug: #1719333

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for Ocata 2018-01-08

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: Icb27ebbdf0a8e3680937ee2de6740c3ae5c6eea1

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for identity module (part 1)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the identity module. This
PS handles the first 10 modules for identity.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: Ia80582119a98e63320859d8473987cdc2196d7e8

'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 10:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'telemetry: Decrease test_telemetry_integration time

To decrease the time test_telemetry_integration takes, we do the
following:

* Enable ManagePolling so ceilometer agents will poll every
  ceilometer::agent::polling::polling_interval interval (already set to
  15)
* We change the publishers list to set an archive policy to use for
  Gnocchi. We use high so one 1 points will be keep every 60s.

Note that the tempest telemetry.alarm_granularity configuration must be
kept in sync with the archive policy. This is done here:
I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

The test should takes 2 minutes instead of 10 after this change.

Change-Id: Ie00d3487d54f4d1226f6a8a210975eabdcd8a96c
Depends-On: I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

commit_message:
ci/telemetry: Decrease test_telemetry_integration time

To decrease the time test_telemetry_integration takes, we do the
following:

* Enable ManagePolling so ceilometer agents will poll every
  ceilometer::agent::polling::polling_interval interval (already set to
  15)
* We change the publishers list to set an archive policy to use for
  Gnocchi. We use high so one 1 points will be keep every 60s.

Note that the tempest telemetry.alarm_granularity configuration must be
kept in sync with the archive policy. This is done here:
I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

The test should takes 2 minutes instead of 10 after this change.

Change-Id: Ie00d3487d54f4d1226f6a8a210975eabdcd8a96c
Depends-On: I62c47723d68bb1cef9733df2f737c3ab3f5aa8fb

commit_message:
Use common functional tox jobs

There's no need to have custom functional jobs, we have them already in
openstack-zuul-jobs. Remove the local definitions and use common one
instead.

Change-Id: I5ecb535612b8cdff5bcbba057caebf241a3b649e

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for identity module (part 2)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the identity module. This
PS handles the last 10 modules for identity.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I6be1dcebf75ff19ba746b24c005d6acc5aeb2787

 - Thin Provisioning
 - SSD Cache
 - Deduplication
 - Compression

commit_message:
Add support for enhanced features to the QNAP Manila driver

This adds enhanced supports to the QNAP Manila driver:
 - Thin Provisioning
 - SSD Cache
 - Deduplication
 - Compression

Change-Id: I0c92ecf6ac55e2f6fbf1d41132e97fa2d40c3ebd
Implements: blueprint qnap-enhance-support

commit_message:
[DNM] add uuid in server migration

``GET /os-migrations``,
``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations/{migration_id}`` and
``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations`` will now return a uuid
value in addition to the migrations id in the response.

Change-Id: I0e0811c6208cf8ca76933ebbf4fd57d75d5f22b3

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I79cc8160e11d11de83d91323ec28ccbe1b5fc15f
(cherry picked from commit 093bae22476e52ec3a387c5154da8943b852542f)
(cherry picked from commit b64f9b7820dab38fc50d76c5dbb746c93d4273c6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-10 16:30:02.000000000', 'message': 'neutron: Extend windowSize for periodic jobs

As periodic jobs are run once per day, we only see if the last run was
successful or failed. The patch extends the period to 7 samples so we
will have a failure percentage of the last 7 runs.

Change-Id: Ibcd47c745c2dd2c9157e0f983f6a3d22214469b1
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: Extend windowSize for periodic jobs

As periodic jobs are run once per day, we only see if the last run was
successful or failed. The patch extends the period to 7 samples so we
will have a failure percentage of the last 7 runs.

Change-Id: Ibcd47c745c2dd2c9157e0f983f6a3d22214469b1

At the beginning of Pike we had to purge a few (or a lot?) of scenario tests from the main integrated gate job because they generated too much load on the SUT and ultimately rendered the integrated gate too slow and too unstable.

This test takes 94+ seconds which is a significant amount of time so I'd rather not add it back into the integrated gate unless it's really needed.  Was the regression on this introduced outside of neutron? If not I think it should be enough to run this in the neutron and tempest gates.

We still run the test on Tempest in the neutron-scenario-multinode job (http://logs.openstack.org/19/493019/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend-ubuntu-xenial-nv/409c755/console.html#_2017-08-11_14_28_45_481334), so the test is not broken by Tempest changes."}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2017-08-13 19:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Ah, perhaps we should just focus on getting our scenario jobs stable enough to vote then.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-24 07:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2017-08-25 12:58:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Ah, perhaps we should just focus on getting our scenario jobs
 > stable enough to vote then.

I think we're just skipping the slow tests in full tempest. Maybe we should enable it there then."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-01-08 16:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
network: Remove slow tag from mac spoofing test

There doesn't appear to be a reason to make this particular patch marked
with slow tag. Other than that, this test covers a port security
extension case that discovered a regression in other jobs but would be
more useful to have it running at the Neutron project itself and on
integrated gate.

Change-Id: Id97dd7ee8197c25607c8f6bf34838ced75dd2b13

[{'created': '2018-01-05 17:31:39.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Fixes requirements install failure with stable jobs.

Change-Id: Ie2bf2618c8e202653a45cde195bd395ab7058dc1
(cherry picked from commit f999996ed1c96c9a5394e314a9c4ae26a0044f19)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Fixes requirements install failure with stable jobs.

Change-Id: Ie2bf2618c8e202653a45cde195bd395ab7058dc1
(cherry picked from commit f999996ed1c96c9a5394e314a9c4ae26a0044f19)

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This
removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify
logging and to avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ibfe04fd84dc50d5d4ad6ad6736e6d8b74c8e41b4
Closes-Bug: 1674577

The infra jobs expect documentation requirements in either
doc/requirements.txt or test-requirements.txt. Since neither is
available, they currently fail.

Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt and use that to
fix releasenotes build. Note that doc/requirements.txt needs some
requirements for code analysis of taskflow.

For the docs environment - which is a developer convenience - use the
same command that is used by OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: Iec65211e5059a4afdd88a45e2c1ac535b8ec97fe
(cherry picked from commit 760f4414eae8fb484f4abeaee454847261228f5c)

commit_message:
Use doc/requirements.txt

The infra jobs expect documentation requirements in either
doc/requirements.txt or test-requirements.txt. Since neither is
available, they currently fail.

Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt and use that to
fix releasenotes build. Note that doc/requirements.txt needs some
requirements for code analysis of taskflow.

For the docs environment - which is a developer convenience - use the
same command that is used by OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: Iec65211e5059a4afdd88a45e2c1ac535b8ec97fe
(cherry picked from commit 760f4414eae8fb484f4abeaee454847261228f5c)

mod_wsgi hangs trying to import the recent versions of
python-gobject-base used by python-keyring library, which is in turn
used by python-keystoneclient. This does not happen if the
WSGIApplicationGroup is global.

Change-Id: I4c7408699fddf327feb1c3b47e8e47cf2dd946f1

'}]
commit_message:
Set WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} as recommended

mod_wsgi hangs trying to import the recent versions of
python-gobject-base used by python-keyring library, which is in turn
used by python-keystoneclient. This does not happen if the
WSGIApplicationGroup is global.

Change-Id: I4c7408699fddf327feb1c3b47e8e47cf2dd946f1
Closes-Bug: #1708655
Closes-Bug: #1624791
Related-Bug: #1700176
(cherry picked from commit dfbc2a56b6fd0cf0a98fe6a2dc046a44c30a05b2)

Set WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} as recommended

mod_wsgi hangs trying to import the recent versions of
python-gobject-base used by python-keyring library, which is in turn
used by python-keystoneclient. This does not happen if the
WSGIApplicationGroup is global.

Change-Id: I4c7408699fddf327feb1c3b47e8e47cf2dd946f1
Closes-Bug: #1708655
Closes-Bug: #1624791
Related-Bug: #1700176
(cherry picked from commit dfbc2a56b6fd0cf0a98fe6a2dc046a44c30a05b2)

commit_message:
Ensure keepalived starts after networking

OSA environments usually have complicated networking configurations
and these often take a little extra time to start. If keepalived
tries to start and bind to a bridge before it's fully online, the
service fails and haproxy is inaccessible. This often happens with
reboots.

This patch adds a systemd override to ensure that the keepalived
service starts after networking is complete in OSA environments.

Partial-Bug: 1738467
Change-Id: I22a534f15ca6a3fc00d9dd40202a63bfa6fa4246

messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-12-18 16:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-18 16:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-08 15:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nGood catch, Markos!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 16:10:44.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: Add missing tags for async tasks

When running the role using a specific tag (eg -t auth), some tasks
try to check the status of the async ones and they fail because the
async task was never executed due to missing the 'always' tag. We can
fix that by adding the missing tags to the async tasks.

For example,

TASK [ansible-hardening : Remove .shosts or shosts.equiv files]
******************************************************************************************************************************
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"failed": true, "msg": "'job_result' is undefined"}

So we add the appropriate tags to the async tasks.

Change-Id: I24a23fb485f2269ae6f627533b3a725f6699d230
(cherry picked from commit d6ead42b8fe48efaec2b61e26a7584cb5a636e06)
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: Add missing tags for async tasks

When running the role using a specific tag (eg -t auth), some tasks
try to check the status of the async ones and they fail because the
async task was never executed due to missing the 'always' tag. We can
fix that by adding the missing tags to the async tasks.

For example,

TASK [ansible-hardening : Remove .shosts or shosts.equiv files]
******************************************************************************************************************************
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"failed": true, "msg": "'job_result' is undefined"}

So we add the appropriate tags to the async tasks.

Change-Id: I24a23fb485f2269ae6f627533b3a725f6699d230
(cherry picked from commit d6ead42b8fe48efaec2b61e26a7584cb5a636e06)

commit_message:
Centralize list of irrelevant files

For python-ironic-inspector-client-tempest-dsvm:
- moves the list of irrelevant-files from project.yaml to
  legacy-*-jobs.yaml
- adds more irrelevant files to the list
- removes requirements.txt from the list of irrelevant files, since
  we want the job to run if this file changes

For openstack-tox-functional, the irrelevant files were added to
that job in openstack-zuul-jobs repo (in
e8a0a62fdc936f8b3e307951c95c3848597124aa).

Change-Id: I3bd1c2b552108f8fccf504696f09034bfe2c40f6

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

(cherry picked from commit bfc8c849df043d7695c70a5e90e5b95e93ce0728)

Change-Id: I4213565195a277f6ed28122899777c090e3e16a1

commit_message:
3PAR: Update CHAP host record when vol migrated to new compute

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

(cherry picked from commit bfc8c849df043d7695c70a5e90e5b95e93ce0728)

Change-Id: I4213565195a277f6ed28122899777c090e3e16a1

commit_message:
Correct 400 response message when x-delete-after is zero

Before an x-delete-after header with value '0' would almost
certainly result in a 400 response, but the response body would
report a problem with x-delete-at. Now the response correctly
blames the x-delete-after header.

Related-Change: I9a1b6826c4c553f0442cfe2bb78cdf49508fa4a5
Change-Id: Ia8d00fcef8893e3b3dd5720da2c8a5ae1e6e4cb8

[{'account_id': 27595, 'date': '2018-01-06 21:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-06 21:26:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
fix of type error

There was incorrect path starting /home/swift, but /home/<your-user-name> is correct for common users.

Change-Id: Ia81b2119c87dd88417428e55c82dac1ab7c028b3
Closes-Bug: 1741378

I re-added the token field. I tried keeping the token separate, but it just doesn't make sense. I found I needed to have the access url in the object because it is needed in the console proxy to do a security check on the incoming protocol. The token cannot be saved in the database and the token is used in the access url, so that can't be saved either. But the object is the obvious place to encapsulate generation of these things because they are part of the authorization of the console connection. So I put the token field back, added the access_url_base and added a property for access_url that generates the url on demand. 

Eventually the dict representations that get passed around will be removed and this object will be used instead. When that happens keeping all this in the object makes a lot of sense."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-28 18:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Verified+1

'}, {'created': '2016-05-26 13:28:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add console auth object

Console auth tokens will be saved in the database
instead of in memory in a console auth server.

Adding the ConsoleAuthToken object that represents
a console auth token with connection info. This
is the data structure that was stored in memcache
in the console auth service.

The ConsoleAuthToken object has class methods
that replace the rpc methods used by the console
auth service. To use this object instead of that
service the calling code will use these methods
instead of call the service rpc API.

Change-Id: Ia13591906ab2b3b7b7d5bc8f4b965c117f08fc9b

commit_message:
Add ConsoleAuthToken object

Console connection authorizations will be saved in
the database instead of in memory in a console auth
server.

The ConsoleAuthToken object has class methods
that replace the rpc methods used by the console
auth service. To use this object instead of that
service the calling code will use these methods
instead of call the service rpc API.

Co-Authored-By: Eli Qiao <qiaoliyong@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: Ia13591906ab2b3b7b7d5bc8f4b965c117f08fc9b

subject: Optionalize instance_uuid in console_auth_token_get_valid()

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-07 16:56:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add console_auth_token_get() method to DB API

The original design of the conversion of consoles to objects and
storing the token authorizations in the database backend proposed
adding the instance UUID to the access URL for consoles and did
additional validation of the instance UUID when getting the token
authorization from the database in the console_auth_token_get_valid()
method.

In testing that design with Tempest jobs, we found that noVNC was not
handling the instance UUID in the access URL as expected and would
not work with existing proxies. So, instead we could change to a design
where we run one websocketproxy per cells v2 cell and avoid adding
instance UUID to access URLs. With that, we need a way to get console
token authorizations from the database without the instance UUID.

Part of blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: I2bf3b56e6b92c40aaf95fa957de452bd7754d859

commit_message:
Optionalize instance_uuid in console_auth_token_get_valid()

The original design of the conversion of consoles to objects and
storing the token authorizations in the database backend proposed
adding the instance UUID to the access URL for consoles and did
additional validation of the instance UUID when getting the token
authorization from the database in the console_auth_token_get_valid()
method.

In testing that design with Tempest jobs, we found that noVNC was not
handling the instance UUID in the access URL as expected and would
not work with existing proxies. So, instead we could change to a design
where we run one websocketproxy per cells v2 cell and avoid adding
instance UUID to access URLs. With that, we need a way to get console
token authorizations from the database without the instance UUID.

Part of blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: I2bf3b56e6b92c40aaf95fa957de452bd7754d859

to openstacksdk easier in the future, too)

commit_message:
Release os-brick 1.15.5

stable/pike has had fixes backported that are needed
by consumers.  Most particularly the fix for making
close on luks volumes idempotent.  This release
includes those changes.

Change-Id: Ifd1a53a0812945adc557f2e754ceaa3adf3a18f4

commit_message:
Release python-brick-cinderclient-ext 0.7.0

This release includes a fix that for the new Cinder
attach API's.  The brick-cinderclient-ext hadn't been
updated to use attachment.complete(attachment_id) as is
required for microversion 3.44.  This release adds the new
complete call.

Making it a feature release for updated dependencies and
added suuport for attachment.complete .

Change-Id: I8e58787b0137cfc7fb5e3e5c7da491f102f50961

deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I5b1ac355370365a7895033e772b418b8c1db8f3f
(cherry picked from commit 7103d2bc5919e818077004adbfe358d4ce9efdb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I5b1ac355370365a7895033e772b418b8c1db8f3f
(cherry picked from commit 7103d2bc5919e818077004adbfe358d4ce9efdb4)

doesn't seem to be working, so leave it as info rather than warn for
now.

to use ifilterfalse/filterfalse which have different names in 2 vs. 3.
There's no reason to NOT run sphinx in python3.

commit_message:
Update for new docs PTI

split docs requirements out into doc/requirements.txt and change the
helper tox docs env to be what the gate is going to be running.

As part of doing this, we can re-enable the enforcer code. However, it
doesn't seem to be working, so leave it as info rather than warn for
now.

Set the jobs and the tox env to use python3. The enforcer module wants
to use ifilterfalse/filterfalse which have different names in 2 vs. 3.
There's no reason to NOT run sphinx in python3.

Change-Id: I358db11b130b909084f7a9e8925477e931d87117

[{'created': '2018-01-08 10:56:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

(cherry picked from commit 7103d2bc5919e818077004adbfe358d4ce9efdb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I5b1ac355370365a7895033e772b418b8c1db8f3f
(cherry picked from commit 7103d2bc5919e818077004adbfe358d4ce9efdb4)

commit_message:
Fix RDO OVN scenario job by checking DB schema (ii)

After I907ce96d2e7b99ff01646a929ac5f60a9150e52f OVN scenario
jobs are still failing for this same reason. There was a case
missing where we didn't check for the external_ids column
in the NAT table.

Closes-Bug: #1740698

Change-Id: I725d0f81526acb9304d5df791144a28d5122b281
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add modal closing components

* Add CloseModalButton and CloseModalXButton which use CloseModal mixin
* Replace closeButton prop in ModalHeader to CloseModalXButton to match PatternFly
  modal close button guidelines
* Use these components instead of repeated usage of CloseModal mixin directly
  in Modals

Change-Id: Iea695f2fbd5245ed510f3a4410e8a21e33afb05a

commit_message:
Add index on token_hash and instance_uuid for console_auth_tokens

Later in the series, we add a query on the console_auth_tokens table
that filters on both token_hash and instance_uuid. This adds an index
for those columns.

Part of blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: I0a4e7a59b9ac6480cd7e0df0a6b96c7e55dcc40d

subject: Rename Resource.get to Resource.fetch
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-03 04:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-01-04 03:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Are we really gonna make Resource2 a subclass of dict again? That will bring a lot of back-and-forth changes to downstream code.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-04 22:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Qiming: This and the two before it (which should really get squashed before we merge them) is a stab at making sdk Resource objects directly returnable from shade methods without the shade methods running a to_dict() on them first. I think if we can accomplish that, it will provide a very nice experience for users of the consolidated end-result - since it means a user would be able to use the two APIs interchangably.

For the most part the only thing that seems to be breaking a *bunch* is the Resource.get method, which overrides the dict.get method that's used all over the place inside of shade methods. My hypothesis is that Resource.get (please re-fetch this same resource) is much more likely to be used inside of openstacksdk (such as in wait_for_delete/wait_for_status) than in consuming code - and that for cases where there is consuming downstream code that uses Resource.get switching that out for Resource.fetch isn't huge churn.

That said- the stack doesn't work yet and there may yet be structural reasons why it's impossible.

I'll try to find you in IRC so we can chat further."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-05 00:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Squashed with 
https://review.openstack.org/530835'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2018-01-08 14:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What's the use case for having Resource be a dict subclass? The original Resource (not v2) was a MutableMapping, but that became problematic for a bunch of reasons, one of which was separating out body properties from header properties (and URL properties were also sort of bad this way). IIRC we had some special key for headers so you would then do like x["_headers"]["some-header]=1 while you would have just done x["name"]="blah" to set the name in the request body.

For one, that special casing became weird, but it also slightly harder to enforce that only some fields would be sent. you could just add whatever keys/values you wanted and we'd send them, and that became problematic with servers that validate that they only get known keys, so while you could do x["asdfasdfasdf"]=1 and send that resource to some services that would silently ignore it, some would cough on it and get some sort of error. That's sort of how we came to what is now Resource2, which only sends properties that are known on the given Resource2 subclass, so what is documented and what is coded is all that gets sent. We also went that way to just have closer to a "one true way" of doing it, because back a while ago half of our examples used the dict interface (which was not how anyone was writing actual code) and half used the property names.'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2018-01-08 14:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ooops, didn't see the comments here, just getting caught on post-vacation email."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 04:25:23.000000000', 'message': "Rename Resource.get to Resource.fetch

In making the Resource class a dict subclass we stepped on the standard
dict method 'get'. Rename the resource method for getting another
Resource based on the current one to 'fetch'. It's not a **great** API break,
but it's mostly the sort of method used internally, so hopefully it
won't wreck TOO much havoc.

Change-Id: I99ab1c4f86ae6a052fbd7cd39136dd68ac2a1aee
"}]
commit_message:
Rename Resource.get to Resource.fetch

In making the Resource class a dict subclass we stepped on the standard
dict method 'get'. Rename the resource method for getting another
Resource based on the current one to 'fetch'. It's not a **great** API break,
but it's mostly the sort of method used internally, so hopefully it
won't wreck TOO much havoc.

Change-Id: I99ab1c4f86ae6a052fbd7cd39136dd68ac2a1aee

(1 comment)

There should be some documentation (probably devref) regarding the added functionality. I think once we switch to use Octavia native API, readiness probe will need to be updated to query about its readiness in addition to the one of neutron. Another issue (but can be refactored later) is that till now, we have all the drivers plugable such that kuryr can serve as an integration infrastructure for SDN controller, not mandatory to be neutron. With the current Readiness check places in the Kuryr service start, it breaks the current flexible support. I think loading the probe via stevedore will keep the flexibility in place.
-1 for the needed documentation; the second point can be resolved later.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2018-01-07 20:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2018-01-07 20:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2018-01-07 22:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

commit_message:
Add readiness checks for Kuryr Controller

This patch checks the health of k8s, Keystone and Neutron,
by using a server that combines all the verifications. Also, checks
if ports are loaded into the pools when required.

Partially Implements: blueprint controller-readiness-liveness-probes
Change-Id: I09121a61d23fb64b326dae3947d5d24b1329cde3

commit_message:
Update paste, policy and rootwrap configurations 2017-12-19

The locations of the previously included templates have been
moved to the standard location used in all other roles. This
helps to allow the sources-branch-updater script be able to
automatically place the updated files processed from the
upstream git repositories.

As there is now a rootwrap filter file, the appropriate tasks
to create the directory and to add the file have been
implemented. A little clean-up of syntax of tasks near those
modified have been included.

Finally - to resolve the ansible-lint issue the use of
systemctl has been removed.

Change-Id: I9b64d5e99dc81a6f35d74c0366ee2bbe7d15d327

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 00:19:51.000000000', 'message': 'Support PEP 345 Project-URL metadata list

A Project-URL list is supported in v1.2 PKG-INFO metadata with
pkginfo 0.6 or later, and is used primarily by PyPI to display
helpful hyperlinks in a generic manner. Add corresponding support
here to be able to pass it through setup.cfg. See the corresponding
section of PEP 345 for details:

    https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/#project-url-multiple-use

Change-Id: I14e580c654b619cab7eb24e31f736056d6cf9bd4
'}, {'created': '2017-11-22 23:57:12.000000000', 'message': 'Support PEP 345 Project-URL metadata

By including one or more Project-URL entries in PKG-INFO metadata,
PyPI can display helpful hyperlinks in a generic manner. Add support
here to be able to pass it through setup.cfg with a project_urls
dict. See the corresponding section of the Core Metadata
Specifications from the Python Packaging User Guide for details:

https://packaging.python.org/specifications/core-metadata/#project-url-multiple-use

Setuptools implementation is underway here:

    https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/1210

Change-Id: I14e580c654b619cab7eb24e31f736056d6cf9bd4
'}]
commit_message:
Support PEP 345 Project-URL metadata

By including one or more Project-URL entries in PKG-INFO metadata,
PyPI can display helpful hyperlinks in a generic manner. Add support
here to be able to pass it through setup.cfg with a project_urls
dict. See the corresponding section of the Core Metadata
Specifications from the Python Packaging User Guide for details:

https://packaging.python.org/specifications/core-metadata/#project-url-multiple-use

Setuptools implementation is underway here:

    https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/1210

Change-Id: I14e580c654b619cab7eb24e31f736056d6cf9bd4

commit_message:
OpenShift: allow scheduling on all nodes

By default OpenShift won't allow scheduling on masters. We'll want to
deploy OpenStack pods on the controllers so we need this enabled, and
we'll need this for CI too.

Change-Id: Ia4190a23c04bda52b17eac50e57da891af615ff4

commit_message:
Update shade team name to OpenStackSDK

The shade team has been renamed, but we still have a few deliverable
files using the old name. This causes problems with some tooling when
looking up team governance data.

Change-Id: Ibfc6e81d4b9b977b9aedd328031f6a2757e0b1e3

commit_message:
Add batch upgrade configs to output & clarify disabled configs

Name the disabled config resources clearly, and wire in the batch
configs to the outputs for potential later use.

Change-Id: I9fa0fc56228898ca1075af5bed232abc8a78f341
Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-updates-per-service

commit_message:
Fix auto-detect crash on monasca-setup when using oslo.config

monasca_setup.detection.utils.load_oslo_configuration() should ignore
options to `from_cmd` that is not oslo.config built-in options. We are
only interested in the options --config-file and --config-dir.

Change-Id: I72dc53d8ee6dc7b0784e6931a19c461cdb322851
Story: 2001303
Task: 5854

commit_message:
Add user-update-attributes to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the user-update-attributes command.

The trove command user-update-attributes is now:
    openstack database user update attributes

Change-Id: I2acc85809cca4595c03a3d4252643a7806d5d791
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 22:06:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix kubelet retries issues

When an error happens during kubelet's ADD request kubelet will trigger
a retry. If aforementioned failure happened after the tap interface was
moved into the host netns, all further kubelet retries of the request
will fail, as Kuryr already moved the host vETH to host netns and Kuryr
isn't ignoring the exception that indicates that vETH was already moved.

This commit aims to fix issue by catching and ignoring exception that
happens when moving host vETH to host netns second time.

Change-Id: I1596585c8b076d09a7f8c854bb524c2374d804e8
Closes-Bug: 1730644
"}, {'created': '2017-11-14 07:57:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix kubelet retries issues

"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 18:13:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix kubelet retries issues

When an error happens during kubelet's ADD request kubelet will trigger
a retry. If aforementioned failure happened after the host-side veth
interface was moved into the host netns, all further kubelet retries of
the request will fail with conflict, as it will be impossible to move
another iface of that name into the host netns.

This commit aims to fix the issue by checking for existence of
conflicting interface in the host netns and removing it if needed.

Change-Id: I1596585c8b076d09a7f8c854bb524c2374d804e8
Closes-Bug: 1730644
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 08:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix kubelet retries issues

interface was moved into the host netns, all further kubelet retries of
the request will fail with conflict, as it will be impossible to move
another iface of that name into the host netns.

This commit aims to fix the issue by checking for existence of
conflicting interface in the host netns and removing it if needed.

Change-Id: I1596585c8b076d09a7f8c854bb524c2374d804e8
Closes-Bug: 1730644

commit_message:
Fix kubelet retries issues

When an error happens during kubelet's ADD request kubelet will trigger
a retry. If aforementioned failure happened after the host-side veth
interface was moved into the host netns, all further kubelet retries of
the request will fail with conflict, as it will be impossible to move
another iface of that name into the host netns.

This commit aims to fix the issue by checking for existence of
conflicting interface in the host netns and removing it if needed.

Change-Id: I1596585c8b076d09a7f8c854bb524c2374d804e8
Closes-Bug: 1730644

commit_message:
Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in multi-line strings

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into
a single space. This makes translator life easier.

Closes-Bug: #1741761

commit_message:
Add configuration-attach/detach to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the configuration-attach/detach command.

The trove command configuration-attach is now:
    openstack database configuration attach
The trove command configuration-detach is now:
    openstack database configuration detach
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

Change-Id: I03c71f6828ff7af8f9caf5c6b383e5e875f348c3

'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 16:28:27.000000000', 'message': 'PyMYSQL 0.8.0 compat fix

In PyMySQL the "MULTI_STATEMENT" flag has been disabled
by default. (see PyMySQL/PyMySQL#590 )

Migration 98 had a single string with multiple statements
ran in a single execution.

Moving this to multiple executions of the same statements
allows the migration to succeed with the new behaviour.

Caused-By: PyMySQL/PyMySQL@c0aa3179406571592d3beb9d5a35badc4047cb79

Change-Id: I5f6d92f695c4c5830b8595b0cecbbafb426470a1
'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 16:28:56.000000000', 'message': 'PyMySQL 0.8.0 compat fix

In PyMySQL the "MULTI_STATEMENT" flag has been disabled
by default. (see PyMySQL/PyMySQL#590 )

Migration 98 had a single string with multiple statements
ran in a single execution.

Moving this to multiple executions of the same statements
allows the migration to succeed with the new behaviour.

Caused-By: PyMySQL/PyMySQL@c0aa3179406571592d3beb9d5a35badc4047cb79

Change-Id: I5f6d92f695c4c5830b8595b0cecbbafb426470a1
'}]
commit_message:
PyMySQL 0.8.0 compat fix

In PyMySQL the "MULTI_STATEMENT" flag has been disabled
by default. (see PyMySQL/PyMySQL#590 )

Migration 98 had a single string with multiple statements
ran in a single execution.

Moving this to multiple executions of the same statements
allows the migration to succeed with the new behaviour.

Caused-By: PyMySQL/PyMySQL@c0aa3179406571592d3beb9d5a35badc4047cb79

Change-Id: I5f6d92f695c4c5830b8595b0cecbbafb426470a1

commit_message:
Reorder cinder service installs

The recommended order that services restart during an upgrade of cinder
is scheduler, volume, backup, and then api. Update the playbook so that
cinder services are also installed in that same order.

Also add back the reloading of services other than cinder-api, as the
misordering may have been the cause of high CPU usage in the past.

Depends-On: I6f39b4da6d4d8a3768f157c73970fe0177885ff3

Change-Id: I81874ffea0afd499228698422842da252fce7dc0

Hello Boden:

Please, take a look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524854/'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Thanks for doing this, but it doesn't seem like the proper depends-on approach was taken (see the sub-bullets that talk about "Publish a Do Not Merge dummy patch" in [1]).


Here's what you want to do to test this out:
- Craft a patch for neutron that uses the placement client from neutron-lib (contained in this patch). This is really the code you will implement once you land the placement client and want to consume it in neutron.
- Submit the neutron "consumption" patch to neutron, but mark it as DO NOT MERGE (-1W). This patch will fail in neutron b/c neutron uses neutron-lib stable branches which won't have this placement client yet... This is expected.
- Update this placement client patch to Depends-On the patch in neutron you submitted above.
- Let the gate run. The legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job herein will pull your sample consumption patch from neutron and run with it. We obviously want this job green since its testing both the placement client herein as well as the sample consumption patch. It gives us a heads-up that neutron will work properly with this neutron-lib change.
- Once the legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src is green with your depends-on patch; we have a good idea this neutron-lib patch is kosher. You can then resubmit this patch without the Depends-On patch and you are done..
- Once the placement client is released with neutron-lib, you can revive your sample consumption patch and land it.


If you have any questions feel free to find me in #openstack-neutron on IRC. Thanks


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/review-guidelines.html'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:50:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

It appears my last comment was incorrect. I didn't realize a separate lib patch was create to test this lib patch... I was expecting the depends-on here for testing... I will review this again soon."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

I'm good with landing this one.. If there's any issues hiding I suspect they'll surface upon consumption and could be addressed then."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-14 09:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Rehome placement client to neutron-lib

The placement client is going to be used by other services aside from
segments; e.g. QoS plugin. It makes sense to move this file to a common
place, like neutron-lib.

Closes-Bug: #1723452
Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: I2f7d204828a620152ec9e005e057fc7fd77f9126

subject: Enable image http source on Horizon

[{'account_id': 26880, 'date': '2017-10-05 13:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26880, 'date': '2017-10-05 13:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As side note:
show_multiple_locations has been set a deprecated on glance in favor of policies. But the v2 api still rely ONLY on this parameter and it's still not possible to use http source even by setting the correct policy.json rules.
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/images.py#L326
There is an "in progress" bug on glance for that but it seems to be abandoned for a long time:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1535437

So to summarize: this parameter is set as deprecated but it's sill on wishlist and not implemented yet.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-10-05 14:15:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Enable image http source on Horizon

This allow to set image source from http on horizon.
It set show_multiple_locations to True on glance.

Change-Id: Ia53d1f9ef0ea74f6e96b6b685392118b0abd0208

commit_message:
Bump cursive to new release 0.2.1

The upper constraints for cursive  have already been bumped for 0.2.1
in I362d6c09148b2b583f4448da65250cb2debfa2c0. Update global
requirements to use latest release that includes change
Ia8310f8cc9604d11cc4a25617b55a1b61436cd71 which helps to fix the
bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1736332.

Change-Id: Ia150d021839a6052e456db5179012cb2e117419a

commit_message:
Make whitelist externals os agnostic

The exact path can vary in different operating systems, also this will
eliminate the following warning:
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-02 22:06:17.000000000', 'message': 'remove get_extended_resources from extensions

Currently the bgpvpn UTs are failing with neutron-lib/master [1]. This
patch addresses the failures by removing the get_extended_resources
method from the bgpvpn related extension classes. The logic contained in
them is already in the base APIExtensionDescriptor class and supports
sub-resources as per [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
networking-bgpvpn/master/legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/
c356255/job-output.txt.gz
[2] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705

Change-Id: Ifbaec5debf3e9ab024f3f877e678c1679c0f9e50
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 18:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'make get_extended_resources class methods

Currently the bgpvpn UTs are failing with neutron-lib/master [1] due to
[2] which is in neutron-lib master, but not yet released. While removing
the get_extended_resources in bgpvpn could fix [1], it causes problems
with sub-resource extensions in [3]. Therefore in order to fix [1], but
also not break [3] we need a temporary fix until [2] is released in the
next version of neutron-lib at which point the get_extended_resources
can be removed herein and [3] will still work.

This patch proposes we make the get_extended_resources classmethods as
a temporary mitigation. Once the next version of neutron-lib is released
and we consume it here, we can remove the get_extended_resources all
together and things will just work (based on my testing).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
networking-bgpvpn/master/legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/
c356255/job-output.txt.gz
[2] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705
[3] I58014ea8629c1c613d1bbab1285d6ff5e25aaf9a

Change-Id: Ifbaec5debf3e9ab024f3f877e678c1679c0f9e50
'}]
commit_message:
make get_extended_resources class methods

Currently the bgpvpn UTs are failing with neutron-lib/master [1] due to
[2] which is in neutron-lib master, but not yet released. While removing
the get_extended_resources in bgpvpn could fix [1], it causes problems
with sub-resource extensions in [3]. Therefore in order to fix [1], but
also not break [3] we need a temporary fix until [2] is released in the
next version of neutron-lib at which point the get_extended_resources
can be removed herein and [3] will still work.

This patch proposes we make the get_extended_resources classmethods as
a temporary mitigation. Once the next version of neutron-lib is released
and we consume it here, we can remove the get_extended_resources all
together and things will just work (based on my testing).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
networking-bgpvpn/master/legacy-periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/
c356255/job-output.txt.gz
[2] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705
[3] I58014ea8629c1c613d1bbab1285d6ff5e25aaf9a

Change-Id: Ifbaec5debf3e9ab024f3f877e678c1679c0f9e50

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-12-21 07:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> Galera stuff can be enabled in kolla-ansible - wsrep_on has to be
 > enabled in some way (rest of stuff is done).
 > 
 > For me it looks like CentOS/Ubuntu packages have it enabled by
 > default - extend_start.sh first runs mysqld with --wsrep-on=OFF but
 > never uses --wsrep-on=ON option which imho is required by Debian.

In mariadb 10.0 is enabled by default (version used in ubuntu/centos), one of the changes in 10.1 is disabled by default.

I would like to migrate to 10.1 for all distros to maintain consistency (and remove EPEL packages too from centos).

As for debian the work need to be done, I'd like to make a global change to install 10.1"}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

[{'created': '2017-12-20 02:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mariadb bootstrap failed on debian aarch64

Currently debian stretch is lacking of MariaDB-Galera-server package for
aarch64, so it will always get timeout exit and bootstrap mariadb failed.

In this case, It might has problem on cluster deployment, but at least make
one mariadb deployment work.

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>

'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 10:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use mariadb 10.1 and it disable Galera feature by
default[1]. So it will always get timeout exit and bootstrap MariaDB failed.

[1] https://mariadb.org/mariadb-10-1-1-galera-support/

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>
'}, {'created': '2017-12-26 02:00:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use MariaDB 10.1.

Regarding to Galera cluster feature, MariaDB 10.1 integrated this feature[1]
whereas MariaDB 10.0 is not.

Option "wsrep-on" behaves different between 10.0 and 10.1. When in 10.0,
even set wsrep-on to 'OFF',  Galera wsrep provider is loaded and wsrep_ready[2]
checking is success. But in 10.1, wsrep_on set to 'OFF' will disable Galera
feature totaly. Galera privider is not loaded and thus wsrep_ready checking
is failed and bootstrap MariaDB failed.

Let's turn on wsrep-on, so that wsrep_ready checking can be success on both
10.0 and 10.1.

[1] https://mariadb.org/mariadb-10-1-1-galera-support/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Depends-On: I8374ac2219ad7880970cd789727d01af7cac1077
Partial-Bug: 1740060
'}, {'created': '2017-12-26 02:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use MariaDB 10.1.

Regarding to Galera cluster feature, MariaDB 10.1 integrated this feature[1]
whereas MariaDB 10.0 is not.

Option "wsrep-on" behaves different between 10.0 and 10.1. When in 10.0,
even set wsrep-on to 'OFF',  Galera wsrep provider is loaded and wsrep_ready[2]
checking is success. But in 10.1, wsrep_on set to 'OFF' will disable Galera
feature totaly. Galera privider is not loaded and thus wsrep_ready checking
is failed and bootstrap MariaDB failed.

Let's turn on wsrep-on, so that wsrep_ready checking can be success on both
10.0 and 10.1.

Use "execute" option instead of "exec", Or it will cause errors in 10.1:
"Using unique option prefix 'exec' is error-prone and can break in the
future. Please use the full name 'execute' instead."

[1] https://mariadb.org/mariadb-10-1-1-galera-support/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Depends-On: I8374ac2219ad7880970cd789727d01af7cac1077
Partial-Bug: 1740060

'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 03:43:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use MariaDB 10.1.

Regarding to Galera cluster feature, MariaDB 10.1 integrated this
feature[1] whereas MariaDB 10.0 is not.

Option "wsrep-on" behaves different between 10.0 and 10.1. When in
10.0, even set wsrep-on to 'OFF',  Galera wsrep provider is loaded
and wsrep_ready[2] checking is success. But in 10.1, wsrep_on set
to 'OFF' will disable Galera feature totaly. Galera privider is not
loaded and thus wsrep_ready checking is failed and bootstrap MariaDB
failed.

Let's turn on wsrep-on, so that wsrep_ready checking can be success
on both 10.0 and 10.1.

There is no need to create a cluster at bootstrap stage. At bootstrap
stage it only do two things creating required system DBs (at
mysql_install_db) and securing the mariadb after Galera provider is
ready (at bootstrap_db). When starting the first node, it will create
a cluster.

Use "-e" option instead of "--exec", Or it will cause error in 10.1:
"Using unique option prefix 'exec' is error-prone and can break in the
future. Please use the full name 'execute' instead."

[1] https://mariadb.org/mariadb-10-1-1-galera-support/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Partial-Bug: 1740060
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 04:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use MariaDB 10.1.

Regarding to Galera cluster feature, MariaDB 10.1 integrated this
feature[1] whereas MariaDB 10.0 is not.

Option "wsrep-on" behaves different between 10.0 and 10.1 [2]:
"Before MariaDB 10.1, even though this variable is ON by default, its value
get automatically adjusted based on whether mandatory configurations to
turn on Galera replication have been specified. Since MariaDB 10.1, it is
set to OFF by default and must be turned on to enable Galera replication."

But, there is no need to create a cluster nor the wsrep_ready checking
at bootstrap stage. At bootstrap stage it only do two things creating
required system DBs (at mysql_install_db) and securing the mariadb
after Galera provider is ready (at bootstrap_db). When starting the
first node, it will create a cluster.

[1] https://mariadb.org/mariadb-10-1-1-galera-support/
[2] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5
Partial-Bug: 1740060
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-03 06:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap failed on Debian

Current Debian Stretch use MariaDB 10.1.

Option "wsrep_on" behaves different between 10.0 and 10.1 [2]:
"Before MariaDB 10.1, even though this variable is ON by default,
its value get automatically adjusted based on whether mandatory
configurations to turn on Galera replication have been specified.
Since MariaDB 10.1, it is set to OFF by default and must be turned
on to enable Galera replication."

So on MariaDB 10.0 although wsrep_on set to OFF, its value will
automatically adjusted to ON because mandatory configurations set
in my.cnf. Whereas on MariaDB 10.1, it will failed at galera provider
'wsrep_ready' checking because wsrep_on is set to OFF.

We can set wsrep_on to ON to handle both 10.0 and 10.1.

But, the point is that the cluster bits, which are creating a cluster
and wsrep_ready checking, are no need at bootstrap stage.

At bootstrap stage it only need to do two things:
Creating required system DBs (by mysql_install_db)
and securing the mariadb (by bootstrap_db).

After the bootstrap stage, it will create a cluster when starting the
first node.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Partial-Bug: 1740060
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Change-Id: Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB bootstrap for 10.1 version

Option "wsrep_on" behaves differently between 10.0 and 10.1 [1]:
"Before MariaDB 10.1, even though this variable is ON by default,
its value get automatically adjusted based on whether mandatory
configurations to turn on Galera replication have been specified.
Since MariaDB 10.1, it is set to OFF by default and must be turned
on to enable Galera replication."

So on MariaDB 10.0 although wsrep_on set to OFF, its value will
automatically adjusted to ON because wsrep mandatory configurations
are set. Whereas on MariaDB 10.1, it will failed at galera provider
'wsrep_ready' checking because wsrep_on is set to OFF.

We can set wsrep_on to ON to handle both 10.0 and 10.1.

But, the point is that the cluster bits, which are creating a cluster
and wsrep_ready checking, are no need at bootstrap stage.

At bootstrap stage it mainly do two things:
Creating required system DBs (by mysql_install_db)
and securing the mariadb (by bootstrap_db).

After the bootstrap stage, it will create a cluster when starting the
first node.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-status-variables/#wsrep_ready

Partial-Bug: 1740060
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>

* Introduce a new config 'enabled_port_drivers'. This config allows
  operators to specify multiple port drivers to enable. This enables
  Kuryr to dynamically choose from a list of port drivers (Veth or
  SRIOV).
* Introduce a new SRIOV port driver for performing SRIOV port binding
* Choose port driver according to the type of the port. If the neutron
  port has SRIOV vnic type, choose the SRIOV port driver. Otherwise,
  choose the normal port driver (i.e. veth).
* To use this feature, users are supposed to pre-create a SRIOV port
  and have the binding:profile populated. Furthermore, users should
  pass the SRIOV port to Kuryr (i.e. using --mac-address <port_mac>
  and/or --ip <port_ip> on 'docker run') so that Kuryr will choose
  the right driver.

Implements: blueprint sriov-support
Change-Id: I0d6552ce4a2c50edb164aff3de802e6239671c2c

commit_message:
Introduce sriov port driver

* Introduce a new config 'enabled_port_drivers'. This config allows
  operators to specify multiple port drivers to enable. This enables
  Kuryr to dynamically choose from a list of port drivers (Veth or
  SRIOV).
* Introduce a new SRIOV port driver for performing SRIOV port binding
* Choose port driver according to the type of the port. If the neutron
  port has SRIOV vnic type, choose the SRIOV port driver. Otherwise,
  choose the normal port driver (i.e. veth).
* To use this feature, users are supposed to pre-create a SRIOV port
  and have the binding:profile populated. Furthermore, users should
  pass the SRIOV port to Kuryr (i.e. using --mac-address <port_mac>
  and/or --ip <port_ip> on 'docker run') so that Kuryr will choose
  the right driver.

Implements: blueprint sriov-support
Change-Id: I0d6552ce4a2c50edb164aff3de802e6239671c2c

commit_message:
Cache ResourceChain role_data to improve performance

Adding this OS::Heat::Value resource makes openstack stack show
for the ControllerResourceChain drop from ~1minute to ~3seconds
in my environment.

This may also improve performance of deploy operations where
convergence is not enabled as heat doesn't store the outputs in
that case.

Change-Id: If52b3a2c0ce29170f05346b92f54286802a84e8e
Closes-Bug: #1738193

commit_message:
Skip ansible-lint test against roles

In order to decouple changes in the roles repositories from changes
needed in other repositories due to the ansible-lint test, the roles
repositories will skip all dependent roles when executing the lint test.
The roles can be updated in time as patches are submitted to those
repositories. In order to do that, we need to stop symlinking the
role into the same directory where its dependent roles are and place
it to its own directory so we can ignore the dependent roles in
ansible-lint.

Change-Id: I49c01fb63054e45bae5ae45a89cce986579959de
Closes-Bug: #1737310

[{'created': '2017-05-10 13:32:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I5b1ac355370365a7895033e772b418b8c1db8f3f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I5b1ac355370365a7895033e772b418b8c1db8f3f

- gate-zun-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/72/456172/4/check/gate-zun-python35/f432103/ : SUCCESS in 2m 13s'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-04-14 22:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@haobing,

Thanks for addressing my comments. The content of this proposal looks good to me. However, I am not sure one thing. Zun has a periodic task to sync the state of each container. I am not sure if there is any conflict between this reset-state command and the periodic task. For example, a user might set the state of a container from 'Running' to 'Error' but the periodic task might reset it back to 'Running' right away. This might looks like a bug from users who see the state was not reset at all. I don't know how to handle in this case. I would like to hear if there is a solution to resolve the potential conflict between this feature and periodic task."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2017-04-18 14:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Hi @haobing,

We discussed this proposal at the team meeting, and I have talked to Alex Xu (Nova core) about the use case of the reset-state command in nova. Based on the feedback, it seems this command doesn't have a strong use case. The 'reset-state' command in Nova was introduced at 2012 and the goal is to give ability for admins to delete an instance in 'Error' state (at that time, nova doesn't allow to delete an 'Error' instance). Zun doesn't have such use case since you can use "zun delete -f xxx" to delete an Error instance. Therefore, I don't think Zun needs to introduce such command. However, please feel free to bring up opposing point of view if you have any.'}, {'account_id': 20160, 'date': '2017-04-19 02:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Hongbin Lu
Thanks for your review, I agree with you.But I have a few questions.
1. If the container task_state is in an intermediate state, such as "container_creating", "container_starting" and so on, should we can to force delete it?
2. If we should not delete the container when task_state in intermediate state, we should to reset the task_state,and then delete it.
If we do not care the task_state, i will abandon this BP.
Thanks'}, {'account_id': 12407, 'date': '2017-04-19 05:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Hi Haobing,

Thanks for working on this. I have few basic queries. Will appreciate if answered.'}, {'account_id': 20160, 'date': '2018-01-08 10:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The zun have "zun delete -f xxx" to delete an abnormal instance. So this path is invalid'}]

commit_message:
reset the state of container

Sometime, zun-compute error or other exceptional situations, a container is likely
to be left in an intermediate state such as creating or deleting.
When this happens, user can not delete the container by the command 'zun delete'.
So, we should have a mechanism to handle the above issues.

Change-Id: I5ac5f2448d9b8baf2a70592a2a6c14b3865717f9
blueprint: reset-state-container

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 12:57:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bug in config conversion processing

The code which converts the oslo.config values to keystonemiddleware
config values fails to take into account the group when pulling the
values out of cfg.CONF resulting in bad values like
<oslo_config.cfg.GroupAttr object at 0x7f53043899d0> for all config
options inside of a group. This patch ensures it takes that group into
account when pulling those values out.

Change-Id: Ic73dce47210d49dc90bf8269ba7a9abbc7d9d9d2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in config conversion processing

The code which converts the oslo.config values to keystonemiddleware
config values fails to take into account the group when pulling the
values out of cfg.CONF resulting in bad values like
<oslo_config.cfg.GroupAttr object at 0x7f53043899d0> for all config
options inside of a group. This patch ensures it takes that group into
account when pulling those values out.

Change-Id: Ic73dce47210d49dc90bf8269ba7a9abbc7d9d9d2

[{'created': '2018-01-03 20:49:55.000000000', 'message': 'Stop building a newton venv for LEAP upgrades

Because "newton" is the last release LEAP upgrades are compatible with
there's no need to build a migration venv for newton. All of the newton
specific migrations will be run during the redeployment phase so this
venv has no specific purpose and is simply prolonging an already long
maintenance.

Change-Id: I06f23ed3bfdca5f1d5d56cb9fabd53cab01b83b6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Stop building a newton venv for LEAP upgrades

Because "newton" is the last release LEAP upgrades are compatible with
there's no need to build a migration venv for newton. All of the newton
specific migrations will be run during the redeployment phase so this
venv has no specific purpose and is simply prolonging an already long
maintenance.

Change-Id: I06f23ed3bfdca5f1d5d56cb9fabd53cab01b83b6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Force delete an instance in any vm_state/task_state

Check vm_state and task_state of the instance when using force-delete
command and delete it in any vm_state and task_state.

Closes-bug: #1704945

Change-Id: Ia6507e57f1bf55665a473a489c24af159373e8c4
Signed-off-by: blkart <blkart.org@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2017-10-27 18:22:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix get_devices_with_ip() to filter addresses correctly

If callers of get_devices_with_ip() pass an ip_cidr, it
could match any ip_cidr in that range on the interface.
We need to call /sbin/ip without the prefix portion of
an IP address to match it exactly.

Determined the unit test for this can't actually check
this case since we are mocking the return value from
/sbin/ip, so modified it to just make sure the dict
is correct.

Added a functional test that adds two IP addresses in
the same IP range to verify that we actually filter
correctly when a 'to=IP' is specified.

Change-Id: I3a95b3bb72a43f322ad23892d8959398aac22a1c
Closes-bug: #1728080
"}, {'created': '2017-10-30 13:03:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix get_devices_with_ip() to filter addresses correctly

commit_message:
Fix callers of get_devices_with_ip() to pass addresses

If callers of get_devices_with_ip(), or
device.addr.list(to=address) pass an ip_cidr, it
could match any ip_cidr in that range on the interface.
Callers need to pass the IP without the prefix portion in
order to match it exactly.  Added a helper utility to
strip the cidr part from a ip_cidr.

Determined the unit test for this can't actually check
this case since we are mocking the return value from
/sbin/ip, so modified it to just make sure the dict
is correct.

Added a functional test that adds two IP addresses in
the same IP range to verify that we actually filter
correctly when a 'to=IP' is specified.

Change-Id: I3a95b3bb72a43f322ad23892d8959398aac22a1c
Closes-bug: #1728080

subject: Use dockerd for docker service
messages:
[{'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2017-12-04 06:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-12-04 07:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

baremetal role pin docker version to 1.12.*, this version uses docker daemon command. If you upgraded afterwards, will cause docker service startup to fail'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2017-12-04 08:03:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Eduardo,
 Thanks. I thought it should have somewhere restricting the version otherwise the bug should have been reported earlier. But I didn't find it:-) Now I think here it is:
  .baremetal/defaults/main.yml: - docker-engine=1.12.*

 So it seems baremetal won't re-install docker-engine if the host already has a later version package installed. That's why I met the problem. It seems still a bug.
 I think we may consider to conditionally generate the command line. e.g. if dockerd exists, use dockerd. Otherwise keep the old daemon command. Or check docker-engine's version. Thoughts?

Regards,
Jianghua"}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-08 09:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon as I think the bug should be fixed by another patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522712/12/ansible/roles/baremetal/templates/docker_systemd_service.j2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 06:53:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use dockerd for docker service

The subcommand of "dockder daemon" was deprecated long ago and has
been removed since V17.12.
https://docs.docker.com/engine/deprecated/#docker-daemon-subcommand

So this commit is to change the docker systemd service to use
dockerd.

Change-Id: I4c796cb79dc70a41f438bc2f96a969a85d5825f0
Closes-Bug: #1736071
'}]
commit_message:
Use dockerd for docker service

The subcommand of "dockder daemon" was deprecated long ago and has
been removed since V17.12.
https://docs.docker.com/engine/deprecated/#docker-daemon-subcommand

So this commit is to change the docker systemd service to use
dockerd.

Change-Id: I4c796cb79dc70a41f438bc2f96a969a85d5825f0
Closes-Bug: #1736071

commit_message:
Fluentd: tidy rbac roles and bindings to live with appropriate rc

This PS brings Fluentd (&bit) inline with other charts by placing the
RBAC roles and bindings in the same template as the pod rc they are
assocated with.

[{'created': '2017-12-22 15:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Also find room for tracks in additional rooms

The get_track_room function failed to also look in
additional rooms to find the room for a given track.

If the event is not running in the current day, we
should default to the first day of the event (useful
for tests and the day before the event starts).

Change-Id: I143eb3b490b3536679e0608064209ec71ed37499
'}]
commit_message:
Also find room for tracks in additional rooms

The get_track_room function failed to also look in
additional rooms to find the room for a given track.

If the event is not running in the current day, we
should default to the first day of the event (useful
for tests and the day before the event starts).

Change-Id: I143eb3b490b3536679e0608064209ec71ed37499

'}]
commit_message:
Reject some commands if a track is not scheduled

If a given track is not scheduled for the day, reject the
now / next / location commands.

Change-Id: I0b57c557534f0bc26eed3d7bdbefabe66e1607a0

get to a fresh start at the beginning of a new day / end of
previous day.

commit_message:
Select current day tab by default

On the room tables, preselect the tabs corresponding to the current
day, rather than always Monday. If the day doesn't exist, find the
first available day tab and select those.

Change-Id: I3c0bc58f35cd39a8c5291d1d6da4547283479e2d

commit_message:
Specify and load event schedule

In order to be able to specify topic/room assignments, we need
a map of the available time slots. Specify that at the config
level.

Change-Id: I58e3d13e169a66c10e74ec9faa97243a40f14ee0

commit_message:
Rooms are now called Tracks

Since a given theme/team may meet in several different
locations during the week, let's call that a "track"
rather than a "room" (which was a confusing concept
since we had "location" as well).

Change-Id: I0978f4c8b33954f53698d8a058b9a802556e56c1

Previously ironic inspector logs were not being collected, as they are
stored in /var/log/kolla/ironic-inspector/ rather than
/var/log/kolla/ironic/. This change modifies the fluentd input

commit_message:
Add ironic inspector to fluentd log collection

Previously ironic inspector logs were not being collected, as they are
stored in /var/log/kolla/ironic-inspector/ rather than
/var/log/kolla/ironic/. This change modifies the fluentd input
configuration to use the correct directory.

Also adds the ironic-inspector service to the fluentd programname
rewrite rule.

Change-Id: Ie5d67f395e4c32fef992e674f2d53dbd6a17f238

[{'created': '2017-12-30 11:54:33.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure inspector uses internal ironic interface

Kolla-ansible typically configures services to access the internal API
endpoint of other services, rather than the default public endpoint.

This change ensures that this is the case for ironic inspector.

Closes-Bug: #1740591

commit_message:
Ensure inspector uses internal ironic interface

Kolla-ansible typically configures services to access the internal API
endpoint of other services, rather than the default public endpoint.

This change ensures that this is the case for ironic inspector.

Change-Id: I998f12435fc1bd306444f9a68bd7f99f5b78f6f8
Closes-Bug: #1740591

subject: Mount kolla_logs volume in bifrost_deploy
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-30 12:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'Mount kolla_logs volume in bifrost_deploy

Using a kolla_logs volume ensures that logs are persistent beyond the
lifespan of the bifrost_deploy container. This is necessary to support
upgrading the bifrost services. It also opens the possibility of log
forwarding, although we do not currently deploy a fluentd container on
the bifrost host.

Change-Id: If3118cd75ccc87b0d003d5f382695aeaa43ed0f8
Partially-implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade
'}]
commit_message:
Mount kolla_logs volume in bifrost_deploy

Using a kolla_logs volume ensures that logs are persistent beyond the
lifespan of the bifrost_deploy container. This is necessary to support
upgrading the bifrost services. It also opens the possibility of log
forwarding, although we do not currently deploy a fluentd container on
the bifrost host.

Change-Id: If3118cd75ccc87b0d003d5f382695aeaa43ed0f8
Partially-implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade

commit_message:
Force flush handlers after persisting ipsec configuration

This will immediately restart ipsec and attempt to listen for
connections.

In further steps we can force initialization of those connections
to avoid timeouts.

Change-Id: I89b643b563570b0defa74d9e11082806de073f40

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

we're using some of the scripts i.e. heat-config-notify
for tests.

Though it's not a good idea to clone heat-agents as part

heat-templates earlier which used to contain these scripts.

Change-Id: I7c7063fadba90fae9fd6fc26a650d38935fe46aa

commit_message:
Clone heat-agents repo with devstack

Clone heat-agents repo with the devstack, as
we're using some of the scripts i.e. heat-config-notify
for tests.

Though it's not a good idea to clone heat-agents as part
of heat devstack plugin installation, we used to clone
heat-templates earlier which used to contain these scripts.

Change-Id: I7c7063fadba90fae9fd6fc26a650d38935fe46aa
