revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 23:18:35.000000000', 'message': "Define resource/output definition sections with constants

It was unclear what the valid arguments to Template.get_section_name() were
(especially since the function is mis-named for what it actually does in
HOT). Define the arguments as constants and don't pass string literals any
more. Be consistent in how we define paths, standardising on the method in
Resource.validate_template().

Change-Id: Ifd073d9889ff60502f78aaa54532cec2b7814d93
"}]
commit_message:
Define resource/output definition sections with constants

It was unclear what the valid arguments to Template.get_section_name() were
(especially since the function is mis-named for what it actually does in
HOT). Define the arguments as constants and don't pass string literals any
more. Be consistent in how we define paths, standardising on the method in
Resource.validate_template().

Change-Id: Ifd073d9889ff60502f78aaa54532cec2b7814d93

subject: Allow paths as lists in function.validate()
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-16 23:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-12-06 10:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-08 07:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 23:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow paths as lists in function.validate()

Previously when calling function.validate() we passed the path to the
function in the template (used for debugging purposes) as a string. This
change allows us to pass it as a list of path components, as we do
elsewhere, so that higher-level code that catches StackValidationFailed
can deal with its components separately.

Change-Id: I017aa6f7511b8478ef8273522ab8087684ae71c6
'}]
commit_message:
Allow paths as lists in function.validate()

Previously when calling function.validate() we passed the path to the
function in the template (used for debugging purposes) as a string. This
change allows us to pass it as a list of path components, as we do
elsewhere, so that higher-level code that catches StackValidationFailed
can deal with its components separately.

Change-Id: I017aa6f7511b8478ef8273522ab8087684ae71c6

commit_message:
Fix the cinder backup action failed when use external ceph

when cinder use external ceph, and edit the cinder-backup.conf follow
the external-ceph-guide.rst, cinder will backup failed because the
backup_ceph_user is not cinder-backup, the patch to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1740222
(cherry picked from commit Ie7213c1280b2b8fc0a4648d09d9ba132427952aa)

commit_message:
Add "--vnffgd-template" to vnffg-update command

This patch will add "--vnffgd-template" to vnffg-update command to support
update VNFFG from file. User can run:
    tacker vnffg-update --vnffgd-template <vnffgd-file-name> vnffg_name
to update the existing VNFFG.

Partially Implements: blueprint update-vnffg

Change-Id: Ief0469d870530693798f798ecd2f52782318795b

commit_message:
Use method validate_integer from oslo.utils

We added method validate_integer in oslo.utils 3.33.0 [1],
so we can simply the method validate_integer in Nova.

Depends-On: I741875eba329b762789a7c7c910a6c46beeff3fa

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508401/

Change-Id: Id90c7f66f75de0264ea70233ee020fab2ddc9012

commit_message:
Add --summarize when running puppet apply

... so we can debug which resources take time etc.

Change-Id: Ie41715b2f4aa53191d20e5e7c3e9a521421248a3
(cherry picked from commit 472a5891110b92bda9f0eaa87a7372c958f91324)

Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2017-05-15 01:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 27599, 'date': '2018-01-08 04:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> What was the alternate solution? Was this every address in any new
 > feature?

Currently, it doesn't support to create a container with privileged mode.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/add-capacities-to-containers
in the new bp list has approved by hongbin. I would glad to restore this patch."}]

commit_message:
Support privileged when create/run a container

To support the parameter "privileged" when create/run
a container, so this container has extended privileges
to operate the device of host.

Change-Id: I200188079fe0445d2b9c66ae37545a1fb3552e72
Implements: blueprint support-zun-create-privileged

commit_message:
Always disable root-squash

Initially, root squashing was only disabled for rw
shares, but it should also be disabled for ro shares.

Closes bug: #1735832

Change-Id: I916e8c6a8fb553350a977795cb1c4ab4ef817b98

commit_message:
Create cinder volume in the correct tenant

If we use a user with admin privilege to create container with
a dynamically created cinder volume, the cinder volume won't be
created in user's tenant (it will actually be created in 'service'
tenant). This is due to a bug on keystone auth creation in
commom/keystone.py module. This patch fixed it.

In addition, this patch also adds the check on the dynamically
created cinder volume to ensure it is usable.

Change-Id: I312e643d02dc5a188d03c50cbac73c2342a61a82
Closes-Bug: #1740938

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary register.yml from upgrade.yml for Nova

upgrade action no need to create endpoint, project, user, and role.
so the register.yml is unnecessary for upgrade.yml. this patch to
remove it.

Change-Id: I7e8d2c03cc596a551cd3e4b9b5214098d666f7ca
Closes-Bug: #1737071
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
MariaDB: simplify db init process

This PS simplifys the db start and init script, increasing
robustness of the mariadb chart on low end hardware. It also
removes some unrequired annotations and moves to more explicit
qualification of the clustering variables.

Change-Id: I6cff5fb6ccfdcc6c82203b0e5eff445ee98bc298

commit_message:
Fix: Validate fail when create group snapshot

During creating group snapshot, status, project_id and user_id
are passed to validator. But there are not included in
group_snapshot schemas.

Change-Id: If8114ac4c8fe5de4e5ba1f1274774c3544b06936
Closes-Bug:1741403

subject: Do not use -y for package install
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 16635, 'name': 'deray', 'email': 'debayan.ray@gmail.com', 'username': 'deray'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25903, 'name': 'Vu Cong Tuan', 'email': 'tuanvc@vn.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'tuanvu'}, {'_account_id': 26001, 'name': 'gongguilan', 'email': 'gongguilan@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'gongguilan'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2017-11-08 07:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-08 10:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As I mentioned on another similar patch, I disagree with this change. I think the commands in the documentation should just work.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2017-11-09 02:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Dmitry,
Thanks for your comment.
Yes, I totally agree that it does work.
However, "-y" option can pull in unexpected things.
Users should be able to choose yes/no when there's an option which needs their confirmation, do you think so?'}, {'account_id': 26001, 'date': '2017-11-09 02:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-11-09 02:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2017-11-09 03:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2017-11-09 03:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thank you, John.
The commit message has been updated.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-09 08:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> However, "-y" option can pull in unexpected things.

You mean, dependency resolution? Yes, this may be the case, but what are the alternatives in the context of a specific package? I think people who are concerned with every package they install are already aware of the -y option.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-02 14:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-01-03 02:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Dmitry Tantsur,
Sorry for the late response. Somehow, I missed the notification email of your comment. I'm really sorry about that.
I believe code conventions make sense, because with "-y" option, unexpected behaviors might occur.
Openstack has always been criticized for being hard to install because not all users are experts, some of the first time users might just copy & paste the command blindly. So making it right is important.
Anyways, if you still have any other concern, please feel free to let me know.
Happy New Year :)'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-01-05 11:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am also of the opinion that the command stated here as part of the installation documentation should work just like that. Hence, kinda disagree with this patch. However, I am **not** down-voting it.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-05 13:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There is absolutely nothing unexpected in an installation command doing installation. And I don't see how a requirement to type "y" in console simplifies life for non-tech users..'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-01-08 01:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Debayan Ray and Dmitry Tantsur,
Thanks for your comment.
Ok, no problem, this patch will be abandoned.
Wish you a great week ahead.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-01-08 01:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I543261f94b2bb3038bca77a926c84b1d2b13d978

commit_message:
KubeADM-AIO: Drive basic CNI configuration via values

This PS drives basic CNI options via ansible playbook in the
KubeADM-AIO container and modifies the calico chart to support
configuration via values.

subject: Fix time skew when using X-Delete-After
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-05 04:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-05 04:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks good from an initial glance. Want to test it before I upgrade to a +2. But might be running out if time today. Will see what I can do.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-05 12:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note for other reviewers...

I was a little concerned about deleting X-Delete-After because it is possible for an operator to have chosen to persist that header [1]. But it turns out that even when it is persisted, it is not returned with a GET or HEAD response [2], so I am no longer concerned that this changes the client API.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/e199192caefef068b5bf57da8b878e0bc82e3453/etc/object-server.conf-sample#L120-L124
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/8d882095375dc53acdafafac40aa2efc3bafbcd4/swift/proxy/controllers/base.py#L70-L85'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:05:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(7 comments)

I've addressed most of my comments in follow ups [1] [2].

The bug fixes look good, the test clean up is good, but only +1 because I would much prefer this to land with the unit tests actually catching a regression - e.g. with [1] squashed in.

Related, but not exactly a follow up, are some doc fixes [3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531403
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531404
[3] https://review.openstack.org/531384"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-05 16:08:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

PS It is still niggling me that we might break someone's backend tooling by taking away X-Delete-After that they have chosen to persist for some reason unbeknown to us.
The allowed_headers thing is weird - it looks like you could easily break SLO etc by setting that option without realising it is not additive."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-05 18:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-05 19:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-05 19:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-01-06 00:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'm super onboard with this."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-06 01:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(6 comments)

Yeah, this is loads better than before.

Why on Earth were we doing two PUTs per test before down in obj/test_server??'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-06 01:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

I think the two PUTs per test were a copy/paste of the expired-POST test, which mutates the object and so has to repeat setup.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 04:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix time skew when using X-Delete-After

When a client sent "X-Delete-After: <n>", the proxy and all object
servers would each compute X-Delete-At as "int(time.time() +
n)". However, since they don't all compute it at exactly the same
time, the objects stored on disk can end up with differing values for
X-Delete-At, and in that case, the object-expirer queue has multiple
entries for the same object (one for each distinct X-Delete-At value).

This commit makes two changes, either one of which is sufficient to
fix the bug.

First, after computing X-Delete-At from X-Delete-After, X-Delete-After
is removed from the request's headers. Thus, the proxy computes
X-Delete-At, and the object servers don't, so there's only a single
value.

Second, computation of X-Delete-At now uses the request's X-Timestamp
instead of time.time(). In the proxy, these values are essentially the
same; the proxy is responsible for setting X-Timestamp. In the object
server, this ensures that all computed X-Delete-At values are
identical, even if the object servers' clocks are not, or if one
object server takes an extra second to respond to a PUT request.

Change-Id: I9a1b6826c4c553f0442cfe2bb78cdf49508fa4a5
Closes-Bug: 1741371
'}, {'created': '2018-01-05 18:15:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix time skew when using X-Delete-After

When a client sent "X-Delete-After: <n>", the proxy and all object
servers would each compute X-Delete-At as "int(time.time() +
n)". However, since they don't all compute it at exactly the same
time, the objects stored on disk can end up with differing values for
X-Delete-At, and in that case, the object-expirer queue has multiple
entries for the same object (one for each distinct X-Delete-At value).

This commit makes two changes, either one of which is sufficient to
fix the bug.

First, after computing X-Delete-At from X-Delete-After, X-Delete-After
is removed from the request's headers. Thus, the proxy computes
X-Delete-At, and the object servers don't, so there's only a single
value.

Second, computation of X-Delete-At now uses the request's X-Timestamp
instead of time.time(). In the proxy, these values are essentially the
same; the proxy is responsible for setting X-Timestamp. In the object
server, this ensures that all computed X-Delete-At values are
identical, even if the object servers' clocks are not, or if one
object server takes an extra second to respond to a PUT request.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9a1b6826c4c553f0442cfe2bb78cdf49508fa4a5
Closes-Bug: 1741371
'}]
commit_message:
Fix time skew when using X-Delete-After

When a client sent "X-Delete-After: <n>", the proxy and all object
servers would each compute X-Delete-At as "int(time.time() +
n)". However, since they don't all compute it at exactly the same
time, the objects stored on disk can end up with differing values for
X-Delete-At, and in that case, the object-expirer queue has multiple
entries for the same object (one for each distinct X-Delete-At value).

This commit makes two changes, either one of which is sufficient to
fix the bug.

First, after computing X-Delete-At from X-Delete-After, X-Delete-After
is removed from the request's headers. Thus, the proxy computes
X-Delete-At, and the object servers don't, so there's only a single
value.

Second, computation of X-Delete-At now uses the request's X-Timestamp
instead of time.time(). In the proxy, these values are essentially the
same; the proxy is responsible for setting X-Timestamp. In the object
server, this ensures that all computed X-Delete-At values are
identical, even if the object servers' clocks are not, or if one
object server takes an extra second to respond to a PUT request.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9a1b6826c4c553f0442cfe2bb78cdf49508fa4a5
Closes-Bug: 1741371

commit_message:
[doc] Reorganize the content of horizon Admin tab

The "Instances" and "Images" was removed form 'System' tab,
"Compute", "Volume" and "Network" tabs were added to "Admin"
tab, and so on. So thispatch reorganize the content
of the "Admin" tab.

Change-Id: I50a1e1741ddb45fa3d4937732fe6555299c93209

commit_message:
Make legacy-osc-placement-dsvm-functional voting and gating

We know this job is passing now and it's also catching
real failures, so we need to make it voting and gating.

Change-Id: Ida5d3efd43e5ac470380373c3ffb40e26cd27a36

commit_message:
Update jobs for ironic-tempest-plugin

* Publish tarballs
* Add documentation jobs
* Remove ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin queue, as both plugins
  were merged into one repository. The ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin
  repository is going to be retired soon. Use ironic queue instead.

Change-Id: If130b765604d606420a4877a548e82d311ef7b9b

[{'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any idea why I got -1 ?? any one?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, you did not follow https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html to split this into two changes'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-11-29 12:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Yes, you did not follow https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html
 > to split this into two changes

I tried understanding this two changes as-in? what should I do more ??'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Read again https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#add-system-required-template'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-12-11 10:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-12-29 08:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2017-12-29 09:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-29 14:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

You can import an existing repository including it's history if
you have one. Once the repository is created, importing is not
possible anymore, changes will have to go through the normal review
process.

If you have a lot of history to import, please use the upstream field
instead of creating a repository and then pushing the patches one at a
time. Pushing a large number of related patches all at one time causes
the CI infrastructure to slow down, which impacts work on all of the
other projects using it. After repo creation the infra team will not
push any content to it; this is your only chance to import directly.

Please confirm that starting with empty repo is fine."}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2018-01-03 13:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Its fresh repo and there are no local repos there..!!!
Please create one :)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-03 13:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-03 15:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

We currently cannot create repositories, removing +2 for now, will add back once our infrastructure is fined.'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2018-01-04 05:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> We currently cannot create repositories, removing +2 for now, will
 > add back once our infrastructure is fined.

Oh ok, when can I expect this to be merged then?? 
Thanks in advance ...!!'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-04 06:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Infra is fixed...'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2018-01-04 06:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Infra is fixed...

Thanks Andreas :)'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-01-07 19:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Create Kingbird-Dashboard Project.

Currently, Kingbird doesnt have User interface.
kingbird dashboard is one among the targets for the Queens Release.

commit_message:
Fix v3 api-ref for showing API details url error

Client were receiving the 302/Found when using the url "/v3".
For showing API v3 details, it should have a '/' behind.

Closes-Bug:#1734053

Change-Id: I7e6cb991151fba19dcaecaf95b332fddc1c02deb
Signed-off-by: Xiaojun Liao <xiaojunliao85@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Tighten up test_check_delete_headers

Previously the tests did not reliably fail when some of the Related-Change
was reverted such that x-delete-at regresses to being relative to time.time().

Related-Change: I9a1b6826c4c553f0442cfe2bb78cdf49508fa4a5
Change-Id: Ie11caa6dda597d6121e241fb82f2f3f5f3a9e9ff

[{'created': '2018-01-02 14:55:52.000000000', 'message': 'Lowering the number of ansible forks to 25

With forks set to 50, we can see upwards of 20GB RSS memory used on the
undercloud (depdning on the size of the overcloud). To reduce this, and
the chance for Ansible to run out of memory, I am recommending to update
this to 25.

To see the impact of forks set to 25:
https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/gseMLc1opbSueaY91tcjjbH9Lub2tnBm?orgId=2

Change-Id: I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085
Closes-Bug: 1740880
'}]
commit_message:
Lowering the number of ansible forks to 25

With forks set to 50, we can see upwards of 20GB RSS memory used on the
undercloud (depdning on the size of the overcloud). To reduce this, and
the chance for Ansible to run out of memory, I am recommending to update
this to 25.

To see the impact of forks set to 25:
https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/gseMLc1opbSueaY91tcjjbH9Lub2tnBm?orgId=2

Change-Id: I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085
Closes-Bug: 1740880

commit_message:
Add chart for mysql exporter

Adds a chart for the prometheus mysql-exporter, and includes basic
rbac rules that may be tightened up in a future change

Change-Id: If1b70bf26d960699cab2c5a32b42dd6316c11621

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq-exporter

Adds a chart for deploying the prometheus rabbitmq exporter, and
includes initial rbac rules which may be tightened up

Change-Id: Iff8e1326f9b3f55d787b63440dd6bd2ba4369d42

commit_message:
MariaDB chart cleanup

This ps brings mariadb inline with the other charts in openstack
helm. It organizes the values trees, removes an unused duplicate
resource tree, and adds the keys for enabling specific manifests

Change-Id: I6f331d51802968620da18b687dc2f9dfa58cdd79

commit_message:
[doc] Modify the content of the configure access and security for instances

The 'Security Groups' is under 'Network' tab, the 'Key Pairs' is
under 'Compute' tab, and so on. So this patch fix them.

Change-Id: Ieea68cd06b049b5b98c6f7d4b98ef9d5da3d7210

subject: Skip horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin when touching test code only
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-06 10:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-07 13:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nhttps://review.openstack.org/531558 confirmed it works expectedly.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-07 13:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-06 10:55:23.000000000', 'message': 'Skip horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin when touching test code only

Test cases of horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin are defined in
tempest-horizon repository. When we touch only test codes,
horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin can be skipped.

The running time of horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin is longest
in our gate jobs and this allows us to get CI results earlier.

Change-Id: I0a29f416885466c3acc47be4f415c20244f9b1a3
'}]
commit_message:
Skip horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin when touching test code only

Test cases of horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin are defined in
tempest-horizon repository. When we touch only test codes,
horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin can be skipped.

The running time of horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin is longest
in our gate jobs and this allows us to get CI results earlier.

Change-Id: I0a29f416885466c3acc47be4f415c20244f9b1a3

subject: Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in multi-line strings
messages:
[{'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-07 06:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-07 10:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

project/networks/templates/networks/ports/_create.html is the only case where adding 'trimmed' helps translators.

Do you need 'trimmed' for other cases? 'trimmed' applied to a single line string helps nothing for translators. Do you really need this?

commit_message:
Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in multi-line strings

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into
a single space. This makes translator life easier.
It was inspired by a previous patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/318896/

Change-Id: Ia4f2d52aa42f4d6c84416903a87618ddff3fbd82
Closes-Bug: #1583757

commit_message:
Remove intree magnum tempest plugin

* It removes magnum tempest plugin reference in favour of using
  newly magnum-tempest-plugin.
* We removed tempest tests resides under functional.api.v1.test-*
  files as they are tempest tests and keeping the rest as they are
  used by functional tests.

Depends-On: Ibdddd26da9cfb0d08c2977660320b2c052d7261b
Change-Id: Ida2fa1ef5880ebead787e3b27ac7ebf5aa498f62

messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-06 14:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-06 15:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-07 13:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLet me merge this as this is a simple gate fix and useful to prevent further doc8 violations.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-06 14:54:47.000000000', 'message': 'tox: run doc8 in pep8

The gate doc/releasenotes jobs do not use tox targets and
call sphinx directly, so doc8 check is not asserted in the gate.
Considering this, this commit adds doc8 check to pep8 job
to ensure doc8 check is applied.

Change-Id: I9df403199264de36b1d0997871e32b29a6988c00
'}, {'created': '2018-01-06 15:29:31.000000000', 'message': 'tox: run doc8 in pep8

The gate doc/releasenotes jobs do not use tox targets and
call sphinx directly, so doc8 check is not asserted in the gate.
Considering this, this commit adds doc8 check to pep8 job
to ensure doc8 check is applied.

Change-Id: I9df403199264de36b1d0997871e32b29a6988c00
'}]
commit_message:
tox: run doc8 in pep8

The gate doc/releasenotes jobs do not use tox targets and
call sphinx directly, so doc8 check is not asserted in the gate.
Considering this, this commit adds doc8 check to pep8 job
to ensure doc8 check is applied.

Change-Id: I9df403199264de36b1d0997871e32b29a6988c00

commit_message:
Remove the redundant codes

DeleteInstance action inherits from tables.DeleteAction.
The parent class has the attribute 'name = "delete"' so
we can remove the unused codes.

Change-Id: I9f312ceafbf84a79b7b7941f255a16632931d5d0

until we fix the dependency we will install it
on venv before running the tempest so it will be
an upstream version

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-26 07:47:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unneeded 'cluster' extra binding

Per ceph documentation and code, there is no need for monitors to use a
dedicated cluster network - only ceph-osds need to have that access.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/configuration/network-config-ref/

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/operations/crush-map/

"CRUSH empowers Ceph clients to communicate with OSDs directly rather
than through a centralized server or broker."

Places in the ceph code where CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER is used
(only library code and osd):

ceph_osd.cc|443| |CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER);
common/pick_address.cc|121| if ((needs & CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER)
common/pick_address.h|10| #define CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER    0x02

In contrast to CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC which is used in all of the
ceph services:

src/ceph_mds.cc|125| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_mon.cc|340| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_mon.cc|638| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_osd.cc|442| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC
src/ceph_syn.cc|51| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/common/pick_address.cc|115| if ((needs & CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC)
src/common/pick_address.h|9| #define CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC     0x01

2 places where a mon does pick_address - both with
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/jewel/src/ceph_mon.cc#L340
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/jewel/src/ceph_mon.cc#L638

As a result, it might be confusing for someone looking at the
metadata.yaml file for this charm if there is a need for monitors to
be connected to the cluster network. It may lead to wrong assumptions,
which is why I think it is a good idea to remove it completely from
extra-bindings.

Change-Id: I2926e1a100f9df5f602da81b14fdc78162cbbb2d

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'cluster' extra binding

Per ceph documentation and code, there is no need for monitors to use a
dedicated cluster network - only ceph-osds need to have that access.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/configuration/network-config-ref/

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/operations/crush-map/

"CRUSH empowers Ceph clients to communicate with OSDs directly rather
than through a centralized server or broker."

Places in the ceph code where CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER is used
(only library code and osd):

ceph_osd.cc|443| |CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER);
common/pick_address.cc|121| if ((needs & CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER)
common/pick_address.h|10| #define CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_CLUSTER    0x02

In contrast to CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC which is used in all of the
ceph services:

src/ceph_mds.cc|125| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_mon.cc|340| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_mon.cc|638| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/ceph_osd.cc|442| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC
src/ceph_syn.cc|51| pick_addresses(g_ceph_context,
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC);
src/common/pick_address.cc|115| if ((needs & CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC)
src/common/pick_address.h|9| #define CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC     0x01

2 places where a mon does pick_address - both with
CEPH_PICK_ADDRESS_PUBLIC:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/jewel/src/ceph_mon.cc#L340
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/jewel/src/ceph_mon.cc#L638

As a result, it might be confusing for someone looking at the
metadata.yaml file for this charm if there is a need for monitors to
be connected to the cluster network. It may lead to wrong assumptions,
which is why I think it is a good idea to remove it completely from
extra-bindings.

Closes-Bug: #1668901

Change-Id: I2926e1a100f9df5f602da81b14fdc78162cbbb2d

commit_message:
Gate: Harden helm serve playbook

This PS make the helm server more robust by moving the server to be
managed via a systemd unit.

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements.txt

Fix doc building with new PTI changes and job updates.

Add a doc/requirements.txt file with all needed dependencies.

Added oslosphinx to doc/requirements since stable/pike had not
switched to openstackdocstheme yet.

Change-Id: Ic7963520aeb0b9c463c4f9b5675589308720d6f8
(cherry picked from commit e7afb739bfa1dec8d9b3dbbaea25243c6931a2f5)
(cherry picked from commit 9ddc3573633fdcaa7f180e7cb207fa90c4b5a903)

commit_message:
Add role_data* keys to inventory

This exposes the RoleData output from the overcloud stack, as noted
there is a workaround for ansible treating variables with nested j2
as undefined that is to expose each key as role_data_<key>

Change-Id: I751abe3673648e1ed7e8cb949af71c2fe1acd016

[{'created': '2018-01-05 20:44:38.000000000', 'message': "Only log deprecation warnings when they are overridden

The policy deprecation logic use to log a warning for operators that
a policy was being removed regardless of the policy being overridden
in a policy file somewhere. This can be somewhat noisy especially if
there isn't anything for the operator to do since they haven't
overridden the default.

This commit changes the check to see if the deprecated policy is
in the file_rules instead of just the registered rules. This means
that operators should only see a deprecated for removal warning
iff they are providing an override.

Change-Id: Ia82516e9a13f6d04be2428b2a03883272be93329
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 21:00:21.000000000', 'message': "Only log deprecation warnings when they are overridden

The policy deprecation logic use to log a warning for operators that
a policy was being removed regardless of the policy being overridden
in a policy file somewhere. This can be somewhat noisy especially if
there isn't anything for the operator to do since they haven't
overridden the default.

This commit changes the check to see if the deprecated policy is
in the file_rules instead of just the registered rules. This means
that operators should only see a deprecated for removal warning
iff they are providing an override.

Change-Id: Ia82516e9a13f6d04be2428b2a03883272be93329
"}]
commit_message:
Only log deprecation warnings when they are overridden

The policy deprecation logic use to log a warning for operators that
a policy was being removed regardless of the policy being overridden
in a policy file somewhere. This can be somewhat noisy especially if
there isn't anything for the operator to do since they haven't
overridden the default.

This commit changes the check to see if the deprecated policy is
in the file_rules instead of just the registered rules. This means
that operators should only see a deprecated for removal warning
iff they are providing an override.

Change-Id: Ia82516e9a13f6d04be2428b2a03883272be93329

commit_message:
Deprecate hyperconverged-ceph.yaml

This file was introduced in Newton to allow for HCI deployments
without requiring the user to edit roles_data.yaml. However, a
more general solution exists to use composable roles without
manually editing roles_data.yaml. This change adds a comment
describing how to use the new method instead.

Change-Id: I72a29a1ddb77fbdf10c9cf190d2ad5e02100d138
Closes-Bug: #1731104
(cherry picked from commit 1e1a86e0b7d012456a0afdd8466e7976edcca85e)

commit_message:
Enable DockerPuppetDebug

docker-puppet.py uses the DockerPuppetDebug boolean to trigger debug
logging. It is disabled by default which makes it hard to understand
what is happening in CI. Let's enable it for CI.

commit_message:
Lower local collector log level

The local collector was added as the default but we're not properly
configuring it anywhere so this results in two log messages being
printed. Let's lower one of the messages to info and leave the one about
non-existing directory as a warning to indicate possible
mis-configuration.

Change-Id: I52ead32cce1eaf5f3816507e8e62b270f1a1a1cd
Closes-Bug: #1691003
